reviews.review:
Japan! Everything in here at Odaiba. It's truly magnifique in Japan! Odaiba in Tokyo has everything from shopping malls to parks to the iconic Rainbow Bridge to Gundam robot to excellent hotels and dining. It's also good neighbor to Tokyo Disneyland and Tokyo Disneysea, and there are free shuttle from Disney Park to and from the hotels here in Odaiba.
There are many smoking areas too!

Lots to do . There are several mall complexes along the coastal area with lots of boutique style shops, coffee shops, restaurants it's easy to access and a different side to Tokyo that's worth seeing if you have time.

Nice view of Tokyo. During our short visit to Odaiba we enjoyed the beautiful Tokyo sunset (both from the Metro station area and from the skyscraper nearby), street performances near the train station and the show in Octoberfest that took place at the same time.

No more than half a day.. Yes its great if you love shopping but prices here are not cheap. There are some novelty things to do with the kids like the Trick photography Museum and Madame Toussauds. The harbour foreshore is pleasant and has a nice view back to the city but I'd recommend just half a day here and then head to the onsen nearby.

Where nature and modern city meets. A park, museum and shopping malls on a man made island. To top it off, there is a Statue of Liberty on the island itself. A good view of the rainbow bridge can be seen and the light up of the Statue of Liberty and rainbow bridge at night is just fabulous. Suitable for all ages and good facilities. For those who love shopping, there are three malls there and it's definitely a good shopping experience.

Sightseeing and shopping heaven. Just seeing that 1:1 Gundam model is an awesome experience in itself, but Odaiba has a lot of other things to offer. There is a replica of statue of Liberty just beside the Aqua City mall, with the Rainbow Bridge and Tokyo Tower in the backdrop (must-see during nighttime!). Lots of places to dine and shop, and the nearby beachfront is a good place to stroll. For fans of Japanese shows, Fuji TV is also in the area.
Fun Day Trip!. Take the monorail over the water to Odaiba, where you can shop your heart out, eat traditional western fast food, and see the replica Statue of Liberty.

Odaiba is the place to be when travelling with kids. Tokyo is our favourite holiday destination and we never leave without spending a few nights in Odaiba. The place has everything to offer from shopping and food to amusement parks for kids. Legoland, Sega Joypolis and Diver City are goof places for children. I love that there is a bridgeway connecting the malls to the hotels around the area.
Not a lot to do if you aren't interested in shopping malls. A very nice island, some attractions like the statue of liberty and Gundam, but not a lot more to do other then shop.

Pokemon heaven. Odaiba is a popular tourist shopping area right on Tokyo bay. It is also famous for Pokemon hunting in the park by the bay. You can get there by subway and there is also a ferry. Must visit if you are a Pokemon go fan

Good for shopping and chilling out.. Odaiba has a great view of Tokyo across the water, especially at sunset. There's a popular beach area where people chill out on the sand or nearby cafes and take in the view. Additionally, the island is home to a few shopping malls which range from a traditional shopping mall with upmarket stores, to a multi-story building filled with independent pop-culture stores.Well worth a visit!

Luck to Join Oktoberfest in Odaiba. I was luck to know their Oktoberfest in Odaiba. They opened from end of September to Oct. 10th. has variety of Beer all around Germany and it has 'schneider weisse' The one I enjoyed in Munich!

A nice place for a stroll. It is fantastic to stroll by the sea, looking at the beautiful white bridge entering Tokyo. The walk by the water is very nice, with a beach, the Statue of Liberty and some other points of interest. There is a lot of people on weekends, so good people watching too. There are several eating options in the shopping centres along the walk. A nice way to spend a relaxing afternoon in Tokyo.
For young people and shopping. Man made island for shopping and night life. Some interesting malls and attractions Like status of liberty and the bridge

Such a beautiful and romantic place . Seeing the sunset in Odaiba's beach was one of the most romantic thing I have seen this year (too bad it was with my best friend!!) You should definitely take dome bento with you and eat on the sand, to enjoy the view... The restaurant and coffee next are insane expensive regarding the quality!

Shopping Shopping Shopping. I think there are at least 3 malls right when you get off the train. Its a pretty cool place with a few tourist picture areas. For the most part the malls were just like here in America.

Great shopping & views. Odaiba consists mainly of several big malls, all next to each other. It's great for shopping. But there is also an entertainment centre with go-karts and obviously there are lots of slot machines. There is a ferris wheel which is great for views of the city on a nice day.

Of Gundam, Shopping & Food!. Odaiba is a man made island with great shopping and entertainment! Also a great place to take cool photos with the giant gundam, ferries wheel, fuji tv building & rainbow bridge! Walk around the place to find Odaiba Venusfort, an outlet mall, where you can find various brands at a discounted price!

Best for an evening entertainment. We took the monorail from Shimbashi, a good fun experience in itself crossing the bridge to the island. The island itself is a modern entertainment centre so good for teenagers maybe small kids too. we did the Ferris wheel which gives you spectacular views of the bay and the skyline. go at dusk and you get both daylight and then lights as the evening descends, middle of August early evening Friday no queues ! the Toyota car area is interesting for petrol heads you can even test drive ?? on their track . ( this activity is not open after about 6pm) .I would suggest you check the map of the area work out which bits will be interesting to the relevant members of your family and you will find something for everyone. Don't go here for a culinary experience, most restaurants are Western attempts ! and far too pricey for what they are so stick with fast food outlet or takeaway. This is a fun modern Japan experience .

An island full of fun, food, and shops. Odaiba is next to the Rainbow Bridge in Tokyo. It is a lovely location to visit. I would recommend taking the ship there from Asakusa. There are plenty of fun shops like retro toy shops, book shops, goofy thing exhibits from the 1980s. There is a big takoyaki court where you can try out several different variations of the superb little octopus-balls. And there is a huge movie and arcade center, with all sorts of fun games for companies too.

Highly over-rated. Odaiba is one of the lowest quality places for a visitor to spend any time. The waters at the beach are too polluted to do anything but wade in (wash your feet when you're crazy enough to do that) and it's overcrowded with nothing but shopping and third-class attractions. Even the ferris wheel can be outdone by too many others around Japan to count.I stay in Hamamatsucho, when I'm in Japan, and my hotel's room always faces that man-made island and Tokyo Bay. The only thing worth doing to get to Odaiba is walking across the Rainbow Bridge and back to Hamamatsucho.On top of that, the kitschy imitation of the Statue of Liberty is an insult to Japan's culture. Yuck!

Good for "a whole day" :). Was really impressed with this big man-made island on the land reclaimed from the Tokyo Bay, with big buildings and highways just like on a mainland.I went over the overpass after coming out of Odaibakaihinkoen Station to the other side, taking about 10 minutes; but my suggestion is go down to the street on the side of the station and start the tour at Decks Mall right there, and then Aqua City Mall beside it, but "be sure" to get to the other side of the buildings, where the boardwalk area is, because that's the "fun side" with: the great smaller-scale replica of the Statue of Liberty (just to view though, a little too far to touch and not big enough to go inside) right beside the boardwalk alongside the waters of the Tokyo Bay, a great view of the Rainbow Bridge, the fairly-spacious Odaiba beach (a decent length, but not a great width), and some music-blaring cafes in the vicinity of the beach; inside Decks itself, there's Madame Tussauds wax museum (I didn't go into it since I've been to two others) and there's Joypolis indoor theme park (not my thing, but maybe a "must place" for those with kids); and right behind Aqua City is Fuji TV Building with a big globe above (with little windows around it, must be the observation place, but I'm not sure if the views would be too good since the building's not too high). Not to be missed after all the stuff as mentioned above at the boardwalk area near the water is the big Gundam Robot right outside Diver City (after going inland from the boardwalk past Fuji TV Building for just like 5 minutes), a great photo-op "free of charge", and yes it's a pretty tall & towering robot!Finally rounding off your Odaiba tour would be Venus Fort at Palette Town (about a 5-to-10-minute walk from Diver City but from the other side of the Robot); go inside and you'll be "in a different place at a different time", namely in a 'town in Italy' in the '16th or 17th century' (with quaint two-storied row houses, a splendid fountain and a church plaza with a pretty imposing church façade on the far end), although inside the stores (on the first floor of the row houses) are just regular stuff as at any other shopping mall. And yes, look up inside this indoor mall and you'll see the 'sky'!And after Venus Fort, the way back to the metro station (Odaibakaihinkoen Station) is just across the big open area in front to the overpass on the other side and a 10-minute walk along it to the other end where the station is. So, doing this kind-of-circular way from the boardwalk area (with Decks & Aqua City) to the Gundam Robot at Diver City to Venus Fort at Palette Town would save you from walking the length of the overpass back & forth (like I did).As for getting here, the most economical way is to take the metro Yurikamome Line from Shimbashi Station to Odaibakaihinkoen Station on the trip that takes just about 15 minutes along the outdoor & "above-ground" route with great views of the Tokyo Bay. There's also a more-expensive option of taking a ferry along the Sumida River (I believe the ferry's from the Asakusa area in the north & going back there).
a day in odaiba!. This is a place that has so many activities that you can choose from, both indoors and outdoors! so many restaurants, check out venus fort!

Fun day or night . Odaiba is a really interesting place to visit, especially in summer. I'd suggest perhaps taking a river cruise ending in Odaiba and spending the afternoon/evening on the beach and boardwalk. There's a lot of entertainment options, including the ferris wheel, arcades, shopping and restaurants. The statue of liberty is fun to take photos by as well.

Romantic at night. We have previously been last time we were in Tokyo.Personal favourites are the amazing feris wheel pretty neon lights at night about 1,000 yen pp can choose a coloured carriage or a plain see through stan up carriage. Next door cool amusement park lots of game and slot machines my personal favourite are the grab machines ( actually win toys not normally in uk sadly).We visited shopping centre next door more high end worth a look quirky venitian style decor ( personally bit tacky).over the bridge from station better shops and more games and restaurants to choose from.

Worth A Visit. Odaiba is a relatively new part of Tokyo and has a number of hotels, restaurants and a man made beach and has become popular because of the link provided by the Rainbow Bridge. It also has some very unusual and interesting architecture.

great city. Odaiba is a popular shopping and entertainment district on a man made island in Tokyo Bay. It originated as a set of small man made fort islands (daiba literally means "fort"), which were built towards the end of the Edo Period (1603-1868) to protect Tokyo against possible attacks from the sea and specifically in response to the gunboat diplomacy of Commodore Perry.More than a century later, the small islands were joined into larger islands by massive landfills, and Tokyo began a spectacular development project aimed to turn the islands into a futuristic residential and business district during the extravagant 1980s. But development was critically slowed after the burst of the "bubble economy" in the early 1990s, leaving Odaiba nearly vacant

good for shopping and relax in evening with frieds. good location for shopping and walk around to see nice things around the city. Very nice weather in the evening, lucky that during my time was not rain.

Great to visit. We find that there are a lot to do in here. Great varieties of shops, games and photo opportunities. Many restaurants to choose from.You can easily spend your whole day here.Recommend to plan for your time first before visit.

A Gundam vs Liberty. Because I visited Japan to accompany my son, a teen who are still crazy about Gundam, so Odaiba became a must for us to be visited. There is a giant Gundam in Odaiba. Yeaaah even I never understood about Gundam, I can enjoy to see this giant robot :). Especially the view become more beautiful at sunset. Not only to see the light of the Gundam but also the Tokyo Bay Bridge and Liberty Statue.As one of the replica of Liberty Statue, here in Odaiba it become one of the icon. Nice views at night around here. After "meet" the giant Gundam, you must "meet" Liberty. Come around sunset. Take pictures. Or just sit down to in the park to enjoy the view. Or may be you want to shop? It's surrounding by malls.
Lots to see. Lots to see, especially if you like shopping. The ferris wheel is beautiful. The only place we really went was Joypolis, but I mostly like people and dog watching outside.
one stop entertainment.... great cuisine from all kinds of locales, great beer, shopping, entertainment in general. Very family friendly as well

Lots of things to do!. Lots of shopping and a few things to visit! come with the Yurikamome line in the first carriage to have the nice view at the Rainbow bridge. Shopping-wise, VenusFort, RiverCity and Aqua City are great. Joypolis for children and many more things to do!

Best view of the bridge. The bridge view is so beautiful. There were a lot of summer activity happening during our visit. The gundum model was cool too. We went back odaiba after dinner that was the time you can see the lights of the bridge. The cool breeze was relaxing and the view from the seaside was mesmerizing.
Day out in Odaiba!!. Visited Odaiba during January with my family. Highly recommend the Toyota centre and the shopping mall nearby. Futuristic experience and great views of the city!

Did not know.... Been to Tokyo several times but never to this area so we thought we'd give it a try. It was a fun day of exploring a new area. Lot's of shopping to be done here. A neat little car museum, a beach, etc. Just so much to see and do!

Fun part of Tokyo. This area of Tokyo is spacious, new, and full of shops, restaurants, and attractions. Ferris wheel is worth the ride and cost. One of the only public beaches in the city. Worth a visit

You need two days to see it all. There's something for everyone at Odaiba. When I visited with family members there was a vintage car show at Venus Fort and a chorale competition, which we loved. My nephews took tons of photos at the giant Gundam robot statue.
Exiting place to feel the Pacific Ocean in Tokyo!. Enjoyable for walking at later times. Very peaceful and quite places. Some sushi restaurants have excellent cuisine and fantastic green tea.

Great place for families. Odaiba is a great place for visitors with children. There are lots of things to do beside shopping!There is the Mirakan, science musuem with great attractions for kids and adults. Legoland, Madame Tussaud's and the Sega Joypolis Center with lots of things to do. Odaiba is a refreshing place to stay with a great view over Tokyo and there is even a small beach

Great Man Made Island. Not many people know, but Odaiba is a man man island now converted into one of the most luxurious areas to shop. It has great malls, and provides a great shopping experience. Other attractions include - Port Area, Ferris wheel, Madam Tussaud, Gaming Arenas, Small Beach, River Cruise, Monorail, Robots, Toyota showroom etc.Monorail is a great way of seeing the area with a lovely ride on top of the rainbow bridge.You can easily spend a whole day in Odaiba area.

Great place for shopping and attractions!. Odaiba is one of the popular shopping places in Tokyo, easily accessible from downtown Tokyo. Just get to the Shimbashi Station and transfer to the Yurikamome line. Legoland, wax museum, ferris wheel, game arcades, VR experience, Gundam front are among the many attractions. You can also take a walk at the beach or even take a quick dip.

A day at Odaiba. Plan before you go because there are so many places (Palette Town, Aqua City, Diver City, Fuji TV Building etc.) to explore. Take the Yurikamome elevated train at Shimbashi Station all the way to the final station, Toyosu. The train crosses Rainbow Bridge, you will see Tokyo Bay and most attractions of Odaiba along the way (early bird gets the front seat plus panoramic view). On return (you don't even have to leave the train), you can choose which station to get off at and where to visit. It is worth the money to get the One-Day Pass (that allows unlimited journeys on the day of purchase) because you can hop on and off the train and go to different places. And it is especially beautiful to stroll on the beach and view the illuminated Rainbow Bridge after sunset.

good views. Odaiba is the Tokyo bay area which is slightly further away from the main city area but well worth the effort. Good fun to walk around the beach area and look past Tokyo's skyscrapers and the rainbow bridge. Off course it's not complete without the customary photo of the statue of liberty replica.
Great. Great place to spent whole day. Many places for shopping, also many attractions. Great view in the evening from odaiba to tokyo city
every time so attractive. once you get off train urikamome,here odaiba.Fuji tv,many mall,many hotel,many attraction wait you.so fantasy place.super recommend for stay ,dish and tourism

A range of activities!. Odaiba was very different to other parts of Tokyo we had been to. There was a Ferris wheel, Toyota mega web, a game arcade and many shopping malls! We also went to the beach to watch sunset which was by rainbow bridge (which only lights up rainbow a few times a year to our disappointment). All in all, we would recommend Odaiba to anyone who has a few days to spare in Tokyo.

There is not much to do here .... We had our first business trip to Tokyo early this year and booked the Hilton Hotel in Odaiba. Hotel was excellent with very spacious rooms, but except some shopping malls and food courts there is nothing you can do at night ... or we were not able to find the spots. Thus we alway went by taxi to some other places in Tokyo.

Great shopping destination . Feels like not in Japan! People talk in English. Best deal for uniqlo! Zara! H&m! Lawson! Toysrus and souvenir. Just remember to bring your passport when you shop to avail of taxfree. With three big malls includes arcades, Lego land, gundam, Statue of Liberty, and lots of places to eat. Worth the trip if you're under pressure for time and need a one stop shop.

Good day trip. We went to Odaiba via ferry as we find the journey relaxing and you get great views of Tokyo. The beach is lovely and it is a small walk to see the replica of the statue of liberty. We also saw the full size Gundam which is always impressive. And ended up on the ferris wheel in the fully transparent car giving a spectacular view of the city. We visited Madame Tussaud's which was fun and tested our knowledge of famous Japanese people.

Asakusa - Odaiba Sea & River Boat Cruise . One of the ways I would recommend to go to Odaiba is taking the River Cruise . I was recommended this trip to try it and it was really worth it . During the cruise you would be able to go up to the open deck and enjoy the beautiful view along the Tokyo Bay water front and the sumida riverside areas including many Tokyo many beautiful structure . It's takes about an hour trip definitely worth the 1550 yen spent . What I love about it is that you can enjoy both new and old Tokyo .

Nice for free time. The purpose of our visit was to see the rainbow bridge and to visit an onsen.it was a nice visit and a cheerfull stroll! But if i had less time i would prefer to visit something else.

Great location from which to explore city. Stayed in Daiba for 2 nights to explore Tokyo. Great location in quitter Bay Area with modern hotels and shopping/eating malls easily accessible. Very safe and all facilities within walking distance. Metro station adjoining hotel which connects into main Tokyo rail and underground systems.Great area as a base away from chaos of main city.
We spent one afternoon there. Very interesting TOYOTA museum with a simulator and we can even try a prototype on a private circuit.

Not only a beach. A Beach in Tokyo? Of course! Maybe isn't the perfect place where swim, but this is a nice place to walk expecially in Sunday afternoon when odaiba usually have some events (idols concert for example). If you want to see a japanese Sunday come here.Furthermore there are a big commercial centre and.... a Real gundam! If you grown up with bread&mecha this is a must! Go to Shimbashi station and take the monorail to odaiba. In the garden of the commercial centre you'll find it!After you Can wait the dusk and see the beautiful Tokyo's skyline.
all in one. On this island is everything. beach, park, shopping mail and Statue of Liberty. If you looking quite place in busy tokyo this is good choice for you for one day.

Odaiba. Odaiba seems to be a reclamation land or at least a harbor area. Surrounded by : Diver City Mall, Aqua City, Ocean Decks, Daiba Parks, rainbow bridge, Liberty Statue and not far from Tokyo Big Sight

Odaiba: a break from the attractions in main Tokyo. After visiting attractions in main Tokyo, a visit to Odaiba would be a break. Just relax..., do some shopping..., admire Kenzo Tange's Fuji TV HQ building..., sit and look at the Rainbow bridge,,
So much to do. So much to do in this area. Suitable for everyone, with any passion. Beach lovers, thrill seekers and shopping fanatics

Best Entertainment District in Tokyo. I made it a point to spend at least one day at Odaiba Waterfront whenever I visit Tokyo. This is one of the best entertainment districts in Tokyo. From the breathtaking view of the waterfront at the elevated walkway (one of the best elevated walkways in the world) to the Gundam statue and the Toyota museum--this is truly an amazing place for me. With all the shopping and dining options housed in the numerous malls and upscale hotels, I never had a dull moment when I am in Odaiba.

Amazing artificial island!. I love it, the island have museums, the madame Tussaund Tokyo, a replica of the Statue of Liberty, oncen, the Gundam 1:1 scale, Fuji Tv and the observation deck inside, etc.
You can have a really good day here

happy place. Odaiba is really good to enjoy Tokyo, for those who like entertainments. Many places to enjoy and relax, but has a different atmosphere compared to other places in Tokyo. Recommended for Young people, friends, family, couple trips.
Nice place. Enjoyed Odaiba even if an heavy storm was hitting it, buildings are astonishing, unfortunately was not operating the big wheel.
another shopping district. We are told by the locals that shops at Odaiba tend to have lower prices comparing to the ones in the city. But we thought prices are pretty much the same.
Beautiful Area, Nice Park. There is a duplicate of Liberty Statue there, also there are some shopping centers. I liked this area a lot.

One time visit is ok. It's a place good for fun shopping and gathering.
The journey from Tokyo to Odaiba is a fun. You need to take yurikamom line from shimboshi or shidome.
Visting Odaiaba in evening should be preferred. You can enjoy the view of rainbow bridge.
A Nice shopping district. Very nice outlet malls and local stores as well. Easy to access via train or ferry boat which is a nice way to see other parts of the city.
Nice park. Calm and reposing neighborhood, several shoppingmalls, a couple noice hotels and spas. all is very clean and to get to the city takes only 15 minutes by monorail

manmade island. A huge manmade island by Tokyo bay. Visited by a monorail ride which is awesome. There is a great actual-size Gundam standing in front of Diver's City which is worth a photo if you are into manga.

Odaiba is a fun place to spend a day!. There's a lot here! You can arrive at Odaiba by going to Tokyo Teleport Station (cool name!). You'll immediately see all the cool modern architecture. Nearby is the Palette town. Mostly shops but a cool display of classic cars. Diver City Mall is nearby. They have an good, but busy, food court and lots of shopping. The Gundam Front exhibit and store is there as well. They have on display all of the Gundam plastic models made (which you can see for free, the rest involves an admission fee). Leisureland and Aqua city is nearby, but I didn't have time to visit. There's really a lot to do here!The Emerging Science museum is really cool (which I'll try to review later).
Spent a day here!. You can easily spend a day in Odaiba - especially if it's sunny. With beaches, parks and amusements it is great for every member of the family, no one will get bored!

Worth visiting: go by boat, walk around and come back with the monorail. This new area of Tokyo is incredible, with many nice big buildings, an artificial beach, a gigantic car museum, a fascinating interactive science museum, a kitch huge shopping center, a Ferris wheel and a brand-new fully automated monorail (sit in the first row, it is like a fun ride). Enjoy a day with the family there.
Gundam meca. If you have kids into Gundam it's a great stop and make sure you get the automated train ride over and wait for chance to sit in front car ... an interesting ride through the buildings.

Odaiba. It sounded interesting in the guide books but did not quite live up. Soul-less and a bit deserted and the architecture wasn't as stunning as I anticipated. The best bits were the monorail joined from Shibuya - a great perspective being well above ground and amongst the buildings and also watching the sunset with a beer or two overlooking the rainbow bridge and colourfully lit boats. A long way out long journey expensive commute and not as brilliant as we had hoped.

Great place to explore. I stayed at Grand Nikko Odaiba (Previously Grand Pacific Le Daiba). There are lots of things to see in Odaiba, from Aqua City, Diver City Mall, Gundam Statue, Miraikan Science Museum and last but not least Oedo-Onsen Monogatari. I would recommend spending a day in Odaiba. You can start from strolling at the beach in front of Aqua City, then go shopping, visit the museum, watch the Gundam statue moves around 5pm and end the day at the onsen.

Endless fun at the Odaiba. First of all the ride on the monorail to Odaiba alone was full of fun. You get on the monorail at the Shimbashi station and the ride is only about 15mins to Odaiba. At the Odaiba, you can find lots of entertainment to fill your whole day. These includes food, Movies, shopping and even the beech for an evening scroll. Just don't forget to bring your wallet!

huge shopping centre - a bit soleless. not quite what I would call a "bay area". Just a huge collection of shops. A bit soulless, but worth doing if you get one of the river cruises from central tokyo

Odaiba and the surrounding. If you take a walk along the river bank facing the sea. There is an artificial island across. You'll get to see s replica of the Lady of Liberty nearby. A good place for morning walk and leisure. The air is reasonably clean too.

Interested place to do good shopping with value money!. One of my favorite place to do good shopping in one place on like 3 connected shipping malls and one outlet malls with place to keep your kids enjoy all the time with good value money. If you visit Tokyo must visited.

Must plan for 1 day in Yokohama!. Families, perfect! Couples, excellent! Groups, outstanding! This is the spot to spend an entire day and everything is walking distance. You've got fabulous photo opportunities of the bay, Tokyo, Rainbow bridge (BTW you can actually walk under the bridge over the bay, super breathtaking since you got trains, and car driving over). Joypolis Mega cool Japan spot where you'll spend at least 3 hours, it's a visual and physical stimulating amusement building with floors of otaku stuff. recommended for older kids and adults. It's a bit noisy and you don't want o upset the balance! Younger kids, do the Lego Land only a minutes walk. Movie theaters. Bars on the beach or bars on top of buildings. Takoyaki museum in Decks shopping plaza over looking the bay. You'll spend at lest 100$ on cool Japan stuff and be amazed. I mean it! When your tired, take a nap under the trees next to the beach! If you want to talk to someone, ask them to take a picture! Pokemon Go ops, too many because there's a station at the 1st Floor of the Deck! Joypolis, Lego Land, and of course beer you must pay for, but why not?

We stayed in Odaiba.. plenty to do... but more shopping / entertainment then historical. There are probably 2000 shops concentrated into a square mile. If you like to shop.. you will be happy. There is more though.. a number of entertainment areas (the Joypolis for one) and arcades as well as the ferris wheel. We also liked the Toyota showcase center.. you can test drive cars...

Summer Time. Very touristy, many attractions and events taking place. At least during summer months not sure what it's like during winter months but I'm sure it's still nice! Definitely for couples and family's! Not so sure for solo traveler! Very nice area!
Amazing!. You have to go there in a sunny day. Just amazing. It is a long promenade with anima characters here and there and very pleasing shadows. Plus take a picture with Tokyo Statue of Liberty!

One evening's visit is not enough. We got to Odaiba around 6:30 pm. There are lots to do there. The shops closes at ９ pm. We did not finish seeing everything there. We will go back for a second visit. Plan more time for Odaiba.

Cornucopia of attractions. Odaiba is a great day trip if you are visiting tokyo, there are so many things to do, there are theme parks, shopping malls, beaches everything. The Miraikan is also located on the island and is also a great place to go. It is easily accessible by monorail. Highly reccomend

Fun...lots to do and see!. I enjoyed a day of shopping, eating and sightseeing at Odaiba. There is so much to see and do, from the replica Statue of Liberty, Gundam statue, Diver City for shops and eateries, Aqua City for more high end goods and the walkway with so many other sites and shops! There is also a view of the waterfront and Rainbow Bridge...go at night to catch the illumination of the Rainbow Bridge.

Plenty of tourist places to go.. Nice quiet location with awesome hotels. Walking distances to several tourist landmarks, restaurants and shops for the entire family. The artificial island is a quiet location with plenty to do. A great place to stay after coming from the bustling city of Tokyo.

Fun outing for family. We went to this artificial island to take my grandson to the Legoland discovery center which he's really enjoyed. N addition there is a wax museum and a great deal of shopping many of which are relatively unique stores and a considerable number of restaurants. Near the tray station is there venues complex which is very much liked the mall at the venizia in Las Vegas. Don't know which came first. There's are many stores for games for older children liked joyopolis and nighttime adult entertainment. Something for everyone's at every age in this entertainment island.
Oasis in the city. Perfect place for exploring Tokyo. Just minutes from the center, but yet quiet and relaxing, away from the crowds. Lots of entertaintment and shopping options
Worth a trip. We went to DECKS Tokyo Beach, there's madame tussauds inside the mall, in front of the mall we got to see rainbow bridge and took photo near Liberty Statue.

Tokyo at its most modern. Odaiba is all modern buildings and transport systems. There are plenty of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants and it even has its own beach. So, you could have a good time here, either staying here or visiting for the day. And while you are here, you can enjoy great views over the city. Not my favourite part of the city, but worth visiting.

Perfect day out. We spent our last day in Tokyo at Odaiba. It was amazing day out to see real life size giant Gundam robot. Many shops to browse, very busy but ok for the weekend. Beautiful spot to see rainbows bridge from there.

A Science-fiction city. I remembered Odaiba island from my previous visit as a place form scifi movies: ultramodern buildings, wide green park areas, Yurikamome monorail transit... Well, it was still the same, something quite different from the rest of the city. You do not go to Tokyo to see the history (Kyoto is for that), you go there to see the future. Odaiba is one great place for this!
Great place to spend an afternoon. You can even spend a whole day there. Nice museum, great shopping, great hotels (if you can afford them) and great atmosphere at the beach in the evening.

good place for entertainment. many kind of entertainment at odaiba. the future science museum, sony museum, sea front, 1:1 gundam. for restaurant, recommend pancakes on the rock. there are some excellent pancakes out there. after all, you can see a good night view there. place i hv sent an good day.

Cheap easy food. Not amazing but not bad. . My husband and I ducked in here to get out of the sun and grab some food. It's comparable to Shari's restaurant but Japanese style.Good service. Ok good. Free refills on pop.

A Quiet Oasis in Tokyo. I stayed in Odaiba during my first week in Tokyo and I wish I had stayed longer. It was a beautiful location and was just far enough from the hectic districts of Tokyo, but not so far away that I couldn't access them when I wanted. Odaiba, as I learned, is actually an artificial island. The view at night is simply amazing and there is a great beach to walk along (no swimming is allowed). There are also a ton of great attractions to visit, such as Aqua City, a giant Gundam Statue, Rainbow Bridge, and much more. I high recommend booking your sty here.
Must See While in Tokyo. Fun Place.. Odaiba is a fun train trip while in the Tokyo area. The shops, restaurants, and view are wonderful. Make it one of your stops in Tokyo.

Something for everyone!. Spent the day in Odaiba touring the attractions. We enjoyed the variety of places all gathered in one place. High points were the Toyota museum and the Science museum. Lots of shopping opportunities and great places to eat in the malls surrounding the garden walkway. A great place to spend the day!

Breathtaking view over Tokyo bay . Came here on the yurikamome line from Shimbashi station. I really enjoyed the ride to the island! Stand/sit at the front to get an amazing view! Didn't expected much of Osaiba, but I was overwhelmed. Came when the sunset and enjoyed the view over Tokyo bay. Wasn't busy at all and worth the 640 yen return ticket.

Plan an Evening on the Artificial Island. This man made island is accessible via the Yurikamome Line from Shimbashi Station. Alternatively you can walk across the Rainbow Bridge if you have the time and your feet are up for it. This island has all sorts of shopping but you are there for the Replica Statue of Liberty and Giant Gundam Robot right? You can also drive some cars in Driver City, ride the Daikanransha Ferris Wheel and soak in Oedo-Onsen-Monogatari which is pretty sweet!
Relaxing time at the beach. Spend our last day in Daiba after an exciting, yet very exhausting, stay in Tokyo and we could really lay back and enjoy the atmosphere, beach and the amazing view.

Awsome winter fireworks. The night we visited it was really cold so we bought hot wine by the bay and waited for the fire works to start. Not too crowded, beautiful BEAUTIFUL scenery. We've enjoyed it a lot. Recomend 100%

nice but ¥¥¥¥. we did free things, looked at skyline, robot near Diver shopping centre, little statue of liberty and the beach. Quite nice. kids liked running up and down steps and escalaters of the TV building. Nice shops and places to eat.

What an interesting area.... Odaiba is a place where always something is going on..Every time I visit Tokyo I always like to visit Odaiba for its shopping, restaurants and that is close to the sea.. Last time I went was last year the only negative I found is that there are some parts of it that may need redecorating (has an old feeling). I recommend the shopping center of Venus Fort..

Interesting. A trip to Odaiba lets you see the new areas in Tokyo on reclaimed land. The Toyota showroom was actually interesting. The Science Museum is there as well as an amusement park .The 2020 Olympics will be held there.

Great shopping area - but be prepared to walk!. This is quite a big area! Heaps to see and do but bring your sneakers as you'll be doing a fair bit of walking from one place to another. The shopping centre is really cool, and besides having a giant robot out the front, has some great shops and restaurants inside.

A little but of fun outside the city . It was our last day in Tokyo and we had done all the major attractions. We decided to catch the 30 min train over to Odaiba from Shinjuku station and walk back over the Rainbow Bridge into the city. You can use your JR pass part way then pay the difference at the last station (approx $6.00 AUD) It a little land of fun for kids or adults. Located out on a man made island, Odaiba has several large shopping malls with your usual brand name stores with Japanese brands mixed in. Lots of places to walk around if you are into people watching. You'll also find plenty to eat. If you're into architecture your eyes will have a feast in this part of Tokyo. Especially the National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation, known as the Miraikan by locals. The main attractions for us were the Rainbow Bridge, miniature Statue of Liberty and Giant Gangdam. Also, were lucky enough to be there the day a Tokyo drift competition was on which was pretty exhilarating!

Don't go on a Monday!!. Lots of attractions closed on the Monday, and we happpened to go on a rainy day so not much to do here with bad weather.Lots of observations opportunities, but we had poor weather.

Fun day trip. It's strange -- I didn't expect to enjoy Odaiba so much but I have to say, it was a great way to spend a whole day and I've since been back several times to show family and friends who come visit me in Tokyo from abroad.The first time around, I went with my boyfriend. We took the monorail in from Shinbashi. Try to get a seat in the front, if you can! There's a great view of the ride if you get the front two seats. When we arrived, we were surprised at how wide all the roads were and how spaced out some of the buildings were. Although I love the use of small space in other areas of Tokyo, it felt like a nice change of pace to be somewhere more open. We spent a lot of time perusing the shops at DiverCity. We ate lunch at the food court there and had some snacks at some of the cafes inside. It got pretty crowded at some points but we never had to wait a super long time to reach the register at any of the shops or restaurants we tried. If you're a Gundam fan, it's pretty cool to see the Gundam up close right outside DiverCity. Somehow the pictures don't do it justice! The build quality is really nice in real life, and the little light shows put on throughout the day are fun to watch if you happen to catch them. On another visit, we went to the onsen with friends and shopped around. Basically, there's a lot to do in Odaiba and you can likely find an enjoyable activity for each person in your party.

Hilton Hotel @Odaiba. We stayed on this side of Tokyo as we wanted to be nearer to the airport for an early return flight. The hotel was excellent and transport into Tokyo by the monorail was amazing. The station was literally a 5 minute walk and the journey fast and easy to the main stations. Odaiba is fantastic, lots to do locally if you just want a lazy day. Sites such as the mini statue of Liberty, Giant robot model, Three shopping center, views of the river, rainbow bridge and Tokyo all on your doorstep. We will definitely stay there again when we return in the late Summer. I recommend it for anyone who does not want to be in downtown Tokyo but be close by it!

Dog lovers paradise!. Odaiba was wonderful for shopping in general, but I'm going to focus my review from a dog-lovers point of view, because I found only a small amount of information on dog related stores here when I was doing my own research. I own 2 chihuahuas and a miniature dachshund and I wanted to bring accessories back to the UK for them. Odaiba is a must see if you are looking for dog items in Tokyo.If you have dogs of your own and want to shop for them, make sure you go to Palette Town Mall and Aqua City Mall. The bottom floors of these malls are positively a dog owners paradise. There are lots of shops focused on dogs - from dog clothes, to collars, harnesses, bags, pushchairs, toys, general care etc. There are also dog friendly cafes, bakeries, play stations, and grooming parlours if you happened to have your dog with you. There is even a place were you can pose with your dog (or show a photo) and have a caricature drawn!My favourite shop was Pet Paradise in Palette Town Mall (they also own Harness Dog in Aqua City Mall, both stores have almost identical products but Pet Paradise is the larger one with more choice). I bought coats, kimonos and dresses here. I also purchased a dog bag and a dog rucksack from other stores in the malls. The clothing from Pet Paradise is really lovely quality - I paid and exchange rate of around £15 -£25 per item - this seems a lot but the quality is really worth it. They also offer special long sizes for dachshunds, which I have never seen before. I had measured my dogs prior to leaving the UK and took a small tape measure to measure the garments, but they do help you determine size if you don't have this. On returning to the UK all the items I bought fit perfectly on my dogs.One of my dogs has problems with his knees and can't always walk - it was fantastic to be able to buy comfortable bags for him to sit in if we go for walks and he gets sore. Finding quality products like this in the UK is hard.It is great fun to people - and dog - watch here. Many Japanese people seem to bring their dogs here, most are pampered in cute outfits, bags and prams. I wish we had malls like this in the UK!

Excellent views and shopping. There are several reasons to go to Odaiba. First, train without any driver, then excellent views on Tokyo (sunset is extremely perfect!!), 3 shopping malls if you need to buy something, Toyota cars exhibition etc. etc. etc. Are you still thinking about going there?:)

Great for contemplating tokyo skyline . If you like landscapes and skylines, this is a great place to spend the afternoon. It offer some museums, shops and stunning skyline view of tokyo bay. Recommend sunset at the beach!

A nice day trip. Spent a good part of the day out here walking around visiting the different malls and enjoying the views along boardwalk. There is more than enough activities to keep everyone busy. The Gundam robot at Diver City mall is well worth the trip out here. The top floor of Diver City Mall has an entertainment complex full of games and activities for all ages. The Wax museum us located in Island Mall, Each mall has plenty of places to eat and use a bathroom. We rode the Yurikamone train all the way to the end before heading back across the Rainbow Bridge. You get to see the island being developed and all the cool architecture along the way.
Nice shopping area with nice things around it. . Nice shopping area with nice things around it. All shops are really nice. Sitting on the waterfront and watching the statue of liberty is very nice

A Very Big, Modern Shopping & Entertainment Complex in a Man-Made Island. If you like shopping and modern entertainment, this huge complex may almost certainly satisfy you. Prior research can help you maximize your time. We only had the chance to visit the life-size Gundam robot (in DiverCity mall) and Toyota Mega Web, a large showroom displaying Toyota's latest cars and technology innovations with some attractions including test-driving (long lines). You can take Yurikamome train, an elevated train with rubber tires, to cross from Tokyo Shimbashi station to Odaiba City through the Rainbow Bridge providing nice view of the harbor, especially at night.

Great little trip!. We took the monorail over the Rainbow Bridge and to the other side of the island past Pallet Town and by the Panasonic HQ. We were then able to walk across the island and see the aforementioned attractions alongside the Gundam Wing statue, Fuji HQ and statue of liberty. We then walked alongside the beach and continued up and over the famous Rainbow Bridge back into Tokyo. We were lucky to be there on such a sunny day and had a great time. There was a fair bit of walking involved but it was worth it to see the sites on Odaiba and views of Tokyo.

Everything in it.... This place has always been my favorite. Jam packed place for various things to do: Shopping, sight-seeing, eating, playing. We always stopped at Daiba station to eat, shop, and take pictures. Then walk to Diver City mall to visit the huge Gundam. Then walk to Aomi station to visit Venus Fort. Day is always well-spent.

Educational and Joyful. Quite a different area of rest of Tokyo. It is obviously planned by town planners. A lot of open area and green.We went to Miraikan, very different from other science museums. It is futuristic, educational and inspiring. Asumo the robot is very cute, too.We also visited the Gundam statue and the mini Statue of Liberty. Nice foto spots.Quite a few shopping malls too!
Gorgeous . Odaiba is probably my favourite part of Tokyo. It's gorgeous looking at the Tokyo skyline and it feels like a world away from the hustle and bustle. Not crowded and very relaxing
Shopping and enteraintment. There are tons of "western" clothes shopes in like 6 malls. Great entertainment options with large arcades and amusement parks!

Mostly for Cirque su Soleil. It is a great place for shopping but depending on the time of the year, it is home to Cirque du Soleil for at least 5 months every two years. It now still showing Totem, up until the end of June. go to Fuji TV web site for info...

Holiday Tokyo. One in my lists too is Odaiba, spend the day here and enjoy the city/view and we did. It was fun and very good experience.Restrooms are excellent, how i wish all countries will have the same. Of course there is also my giant Gundam which i find excellent beauty, thank you for the wonderful experience.

A place to go on a rainy day. Basically a man made island with a mixture of office building and shopping complex. We only went to check it out because the weather forecast was rain the whole day thus I reckon some refuge indoors. We went between Aqua City, Diver City & Palette Town. These 3 shopping complex are pretty much interconnected by a pedestrian bridge however they are only half covered so we still had to utilise an umbrella. Aqua city had good views of Tokyo and the rainbow bridge, Diver city had the giant Gundam which was impressive (not a Gundam fan) and the highlight @ Palette Town is the Toyota Mega Web where there were plenty of free interactive activities as well current Toyota car display and also prototypes. Aqua city & Diver City are pretty much your normal shopping complex while Palette Town has an outlet floor which we found to be really expensive for an Outlet while the rest of Palette Town is decorated in a fake Italian style which was pretty tacky. I wouldn't recommend Odaiba as a must see place but if you have plenty of time in Tokyo and it is raining, you could give Odaiba a visit.

Grand Pacific Le Daiba Changing to Tokyo Nikko Hotel Eff 7/1/16. We LOVE staying at the luxurious Grand Pacific Le Daiba! Effective July 1, 2016, the Nikko chain takes over. Hopefully the excellent staff will stay on.
It was ok . Went at night . Was a great view of Tokyo at night . Plenty of shops to keep you busy and of course the gundam robot to see . Plenty of walking but overall it was ok .

A day trip. We spent most of the day out here. There is quite a bit to see out here. Great for shopping if you need to buy gifts.The day we went was a Saturday and there was a reggae festival on which was cool.Im told this place is amazing at night but we were so tired and had alot of shopping.Fyi they wont let you into leggo land with out any kids.
Nice View of Tokyo. Odaiba is a final stop of Tokyo Cruise. Lots of shopping places and restaurant nearby. A must for you to visit Gandam Robot here if you're fan of them!!!

Not a good experience. My husband and I went for the usual Sunday lunch with the children. Were impressed by the terrace and nice view of Hilton Odaiba. Walked in at 2 pm to nice and airy Veranda as the place looked only a small third full, and tried to have a table at 4 different areas but were told each time that these were already booked. Only back of bar counter was offered to us with service trays laying on it and the waiter showing us a reluctant face. We decided to walk out and crossed the hall to Taronga. Ordered champagne brunch for us and kids plates for the children. Were served barely over a half flute and had to call 2 waiters to convince them that it was an unreasonable serving - they reluctantly topped up to a 2/3 glass. Ordered salmon with lobster risotto as main course but was unfortunately a poor culinary experience - the fish was over cooked and extremely salty. We left disappointed and unhappy... Not the usual Hilton experience :(

Worth visiting if you're in Tokyo more than 4 days. I wouldn't come to Odaiba unless you're spending a considerable amount of time in Tokyo, or unless you have kids. It's a great family attraction, just walking around can be fun. It's also much better in good weather, as the majority of the island is outdoors. I personally went for the onsen, but it was packed with a line going around the block! The 'beach' area is nice with plenty of couples and families picnicking. In all honesty though, if you're only in Tokyo for a few days, I'd skip Odaiba. It's a lot bigger than I thought, so walking from one end to the other takes close to an hour. Oh and a side note - the monorail style train coming in to the island is actually really cool - all the kids had a great time sitting at the front going around the corners!

Too many places to explore!. It has almost everything you want to see. Lot of different things to explore - shopping places, beach, restaurants. It is better to reach there in the morning, it would impossible to explore the whole place in a day otherwise.

Incredible views. We visited Odaiba and it was very relaxing compared with other areas. There are lots of places where to go and be impressed such as Fuji tv building, statue of liberty replica, rainbow bridge, a colossal shopping center, Mazinger Z robot, etc... It is a very nice and quiet although there always are people around. However if you want to make your stay in a relaxing way, this might be your place!
Worthwhile visit. An excellent place to visit--many tourist attractions and shopping. Do take the cruise across the bay.

Outstanding view and great shopoing. This is area of Tokio is quite nice. Breathtaking views and great shopping mall with all kinds of options to eat. Great area to spend a day looking around, walking by the water and enjoying the city skyline.

Quite different from rest of Tokyo. Has some nice attractions. We had only half a day to spare for Odaiba, so this review is for those who don't have a lot of time to spare. We took the Yurikamome (elevated train with rubber wheels) from Shimbashi station to reach Odaiba (tip - get off at the Daiba station, not the Odaiba-kaihinkōen as the Daiba station is closer to the major attractions).We saw the Fuji television studio from outside. The walk from the station to the mall outside which the Gundam statue is placed is quite pleasant. If you just want to see the statue, you don't need to enter the mall - just walk around the mall till you see it. The statue was definitely impressive. Even if you are not a Gundam fan or don't know a thing about it, it still looks great. From there, we saw the replica of the Statue of Liberty - it looks really nice against the backdrop of a bridge and the Tokyo skyline...makes for some very nice pics. If one has more time, you can spend it in the malls and entertainment parks, but just walking around the place itself is a nice experience. It is quite open and not congested like other places in Tokyo.

Lots to see and do just outside of downtown Tokyo. The area is huge with three shopping malls, a large ferris wheel, and offices, hotels, apartment buildings, and park area. It is also very clean and safe. It had several attractions in the area too.

Enjoyable. Really enjoyed Odaiba actually kinda stumbled on it as it was my last day in Tokyo and had to kill some time before heading for the airport. The is entertaining great site to just stroke around and get away from the city. Plenty of atractinions too. You can cart and even beter there is the cirque de soleil. All and all a great alternative to busy Tokyo

Rainy Day Fun. We came here on a rainy deary day. It’s a good place to send the day indoors, as there are many malls, and entertainment venues. There are various shops, cafes, restaurants, and food courts at each of the major malls. On a nice day you have a great view of the harbor. You can see Rainbow Bridge and a replica of the statue of liberty. You can easily spend the whole day here.

So beautiful!!!!. Odaiba is a is land connect to tokyo by rainbow bridge, it is nice place to see sunrise or sunset, you can see the liberal status which is symbol of US!! I recommend you to walk by foot from odaiba to tokyo in rainbows bridge, you should enter before 6pm because it will be close after 6pm. From the bridge you can see tokyo tower, skytree and the whole tokyo near the river... So beautiful

Wonderful view of the sea . Great place for Gundam amd modernity lovers! The view of the giant robot is wonderful and not so far from there there's a great view of the ocean and the Miraikan museum. Very worth to vist everything!

Fantastic place for a date. Lovely place for a date, there's everything you need. The sea, amusement park, shopping malls...anything you want. At the time I was there, there was a Spring Octoberfest so it was really fun with performances and alcohol. Like a real fun fair. The malls are so beautifully designed and the Toyota showroom was really impressive. I enjoyed the historical garage as well. The beach is really beautiful and there are plenty of different F&B outlets to choose from. You can spend the entire day at Odaiba and not feel bored.

Odiaba Island. I Love Odiaba when I was living in Tokyo and visited whenever I'm in Tokyo. It's a one-stop-fun place for every age and all kinds of food. One can spend a whole day there alone and with family. It is a shopping centre, boat rides, Fuji TV studio, Tokyo Big Sight (exhibition hall for art and antique market), Tokyo Leisure for video games, bowling and karaoke, Food court with many different international restaurant, but my favorite is a whole floor of specializing in all type of Ramen (Japanese Noodle soup). Plus much much more... Oh there is also movie cinemas as well. If you run out of things to do in Tokyo (not that you will), Odaiba is definitely a place to visit.

Adventure discovery. Odaiba is an island by itself with a monorail train service within and subway train service connection or by bus thru the rainbow bridge. Hotels,shopping, food,entertainment, park, museums, a lot to be done. Grab a odaiba island map at the train station to guide you around, better yet book a hotel at the island for your unhampered tour, it's very near Tokyo haneda airport, and Disneyland.
Relaxing . Unlike other parts of Tokyo , it feel relaxing in the area. Good harbor view. Big shopping center. There is also onsen park in the area to destress
Beautiful Place!. Come here twice every year. Beautiful view from any angle. Great shopping and eating area. Prepare for expensive cost of commute within this area, even via train.

A high end shopping and entertainment district. We stayed in Odaida. It is a mix of shopping and entertainment. You can spend few hours to a day depending o~ your liking.They have a statue of liberty and nice seafront garden.As we were staying there we explored it every evening.We loved the area and would visit it again.

It's not Japan.. My Japanese friends/co-workers heavily suggested that I spend a day in Odaiba. I shouldn't have listened to them. As a non-Japanese, I'm not really interested in living in a foreign country, and doing the same stuff I used to do in my native land. What makes a different culture seem appealing, is that it's DIFFERENT. But Odaiba is simply not Japanese. The first fact that gives it away as being among the worst consequences of globalization, is that only about 10% of the people in Odaiba are Japanese (mostly just the employees of the many shops). So call me strange, because I prefer to submerge myself in the culture of the country I visit... For this reason, I hated Odaiba.
I love this place!. For me that is one of the most beautiful place in Tokyo area!The amazing view start from the monorail to get there and continue to the amazing view from Fuji TV!

Manmade but interesting. They have a statue of liberty, a large saw just outside Tokyo Big Site the convention centre, a ferris wheel, large shopping mall Venusfort. Everything is large on this manmade island. You can easily spend half a day or more here if you are into theme parks or shopping.

Heaven for shoppers and kids. This is my favourite place to stay in Tokyo. The hotels are reasonably cheap and they have free shuttle bus to Disneyland. Odaiba has at least 4 malls which are in 15 minutes walking range. There are some interesting places for small kids like sony in aquatic mall. And you can find some cheap things (when they are on sale) at the malls.

Tokyo Overload!. In Odaiba, you are never more than a couple hundred feet from an interesting attraction. We spent an entire day just walking around and I feel like we barely scratched the surface of what Odaiba has to offer.

Go there with kids. There is a shopping mall with lots of shops for kids. Main attraction for kids is the ferris wheel. And very cool is de Miraikan museum, esp the Azimo robot demo. A nice afternoon trip with kids after a visit to the fish market.

Relaxing experience . This is an artificial island in Tokyo that is connected to the mainland via monorail and road. The place contains shopping malls, residential apartments and commercial entities. Yet it has a quiet and relaxing air about it.
I could find a good Indian restaurant. We could spot India food which was very good. Nan were very soft and they served good basmat rice as well.

Interesting area - lots to do. This is quite a action packed area. It comprises shopping in different, yet closely situated malls. There are other activities, like Oktoberfest that occur here (in May!). Definitely stuff to do. And the 18m tall Gundam statue is here also. Only issue is that it is further out requiring several trains and connections to get to.

Great during sunset and night.. Odaiba has so many things to see!From Aquacity, The Decks, Fuji TV and Sumida Park, this is the best destinations for you who travelled with friends or family.I love it during sunset since the view of Rainbow Bridge was so stunning. It's even prettier at night! The lights would amaze you :)
Nice place!. Came here during the evening and saw the area slowly get lighted up at night, which is beautiful! Don't miss the Gundam statue and the mini Statue of Liberty. Also the odaiba bridge!
Nice place. a decent place to travel. The best way is to travel by the subway. It is very cheap and easy to travel by the subway lines and to explore Tokyo.

Lovely beach walk . Suggest getting off at the Odaiba kaihinkoen stop on the Yurikamome Line (it's the monorail line). Great view as you cross the Rainbow bridge. Return home - get on the monorail outside of Mega Web - station name is Aomi.Enjoyed walking along the beach front and taking pictures with the "Statue Of Liberty"Many restaurants available inside Beach Deck and Aqua City. Highlights include: Gundam Statue and gift shop; Mega Web with Toyota Showcase - many simulators and exhibits; large Ferris wheel.Allow at least 8 - 10 hours to enjoy the island.

Cool area. Odaiba is a really cool area to visit, we went in the evening and it was really beautiful, lit up by lights everywhere you looked. There is also lots to do for everyone, restaurants, shops etc.

Future Island. Odaiba is one of the attraction for the whole day=) is the thematic park with of few of different statues, a lot of shops, one 150 m high Ferris wheel=) Me nd my Broder spendet long time there, because there is a lot to see, the island itself is very cosmic, and all of the smoll statues are cute=) if you are tired of outside seesigthings - go shopping or eathing in one of the shopping center=) The Ferris wheel is awesome, it is really high, the view is amazing and in the evening it shines everything there=)

Fun Games and shopping. Odaiba is the place to be on a rainy day. Or at least for me it was. The artifical island in the Tokyo bay is a spot for a lot of shopping, fun and spectacular views of the tokyo skyline and the Rainbow bridge. In Odaiba you can stay all day and never run out of things to do.

Good for families with young children. With mega kids store like Toy'r'us and baby'r'us, nishimatsuya, etc...this is a shopping heaven for families with children. Malls open till 9pm, which is good for families to spend a whole day at the place. Great view of the city too!
Stayed In Odaiba every time!. Away from Hustle Bustle of Tokyo I wont stay anyone but in Daiba love it here, feels like home already :D

Shopping. If you want an incredible view of the city during sunset this is the place to be. If you want to shop. This is the place. Also had incredible sushi at a restaurant I'm not sure the name of. Right beside 'Jonathan's'.

Great views of Tokyo, shopping, young people's magnet. Odaiba, since the installation of the rainbow bridge, the Yurikamome Line, and the Rinkai Line, has grown and grown. There are excellent hotels (Grand Pacific Le Daiba and the Hilton, for two), shopping all over the place, a Ferris wheel, beaches, walks along the Bay, restaurants, a fake Statue of Liberty, and stunning views of the Tokyo skyline. It is filled with young people, giving it a very lively vibe.

Other side of Tokyo. Odaiba is an island and it seems like a completely different city, not part of Tokyo. It's really interesting place to walk around. Try science museum, water science museum if you have time. On the harbour you can visit old whale-fishing boat (free entry, you can donate some money if you want). Plenty of shopping centers. If you are anime fan, you can go there to see huge animated figure of Gundam Wing robot.

the flower blooms were a surprise.... i never knew how colorful spring season can be...and yes, Odaiba blew me by surprise with tulips of different colors and variety all around...the flower loving me was caught off guard that i nearly forgot i have kiddos along...

Great place to visit - don't miss Panasonic room (Toyota was also ok). We went there did not know what to expect so didn't plan too much time to visit there We walked around some of the places , we spent time at the Toyota showroom and then went by foot to the Panasonic show room (which I think was the highlight)Panasonic showed a lot of technologies - ask at the information booth inside the Panasonic building for the tour on the 4th floor (we actually got a private tour which was fascinating) there are museums on the 2nd and 3rd floor but unfortunately we didn't have enough time but i think that Odaiba has a lot to offer from what we have seen and seems like a great place to spend a full day
Great place for families. This was a great place to visit for families! Lots to do and lots of attractions to visit! Highly recommended!

Awesome Bay area shopping and entertainment, fit for a whole year . Awesome Bay area shopping and entertainment, fit for a whole year. Plenty of restaurants and shopping malls bunched together in a wide, pedestrian friendly seaside area.
Shopping area. A very nice place with plenty of malls and hotels. It is overlooking tokyo. There is a statue of liberty and a manmade beachfront. I would say a must visit.

A great monorail ride. We took the monorail out to Odaiba island and back one morning. There's some great views out over rainbow bridge as you approach and then some amazing futuristic architecture to be seen during the ride. We stopped off at one of the shopping malls for a coffee (the one near the Hilton hotel) and there's a few things to see around there but we were short of time and so couldn't do more. However the ride was very enjoyable and I would recommend it.

You can spend a full day here. The island of Odaiba has everything you want. Adventure parks, malls, Exhibition Center, Athletic Activities, Promenade Areas. You just have everything here. Though it is difficult to walk around from one site to the other in Odaiba. You need to select carefully what you plan to do, and than make a route plan.

Spend the day in Odaiba. We wanted to see the ferris wheel,. We managed to get to Odaiba quite easily by subway and the train. The first sight that greeted us was that amazing Fujitsu building with the huge copper dome. We spent an entire day just walking around. My husband spent a lot of time in the Toyota showroom and I enjoyed the mall that looked like Caeser's palace. This place has a fabulous vibe and lots of people walking their dogs. My teens , who did not accompany us on this trip would have loved this place.

If you want a break from traditional Tokyo. Odaiba is like a modern reimagining of Tokyo. Its full of malls and big scale attractions. Definitely worth a day trip if you are in Tokyo. It is full of shopping and sight seeying and also has a few good arcades. Best to plan ahead as some attractions need advanced bookings. Overall nice place to shop.
Odaiba - Sight See and Shopping. Fairly accessible to get to. Full of mega malls with lots of shopping and thematic attractions. There's also an outlet mall in Venus Fort

Odaiba - the Modern Tokyo. This man-made island showcases the modern side of Tokyo. It is now one of the more popular tourist attractions in Tokyo. It is both a business and residential district. They have a wide variety of shopping malls, restaurants and activity areas. It is accessible by taking the Yurikamome train. The view at night is so nice.

お台場 - O'Daiba. お台場は東京湾にある人工島だね。江戸時代に江戸を守るため作った。あの時には、ペリーの黒船は敵だったね。要塞跡まだある。興味深い歴史だよ。この頃、自然じゃない海岸もある。砂がどこから来たのが分らん。ガンダム、要塞、高層ビル、クモ、二次橋など。O'Daiba was created at the end of the Edo Era in the 1850s to protect Tokyo from the coming threat of the black ships under commander Perry. There were at least six batteries built for cannon emplacement. Now no.3 battery is a park where as no.6 is an island abandoned to nature in the bay. It is an early and one of many artificial islands in Tokyo Bay, and is now a commercial neighbourhood. It feels like a self-contained town where everybody lives in highrise.Oh, and waiting for that gundam thing to move was the most pointless thing I've ever done in Japan.

One of the Tokyo Attractions. Nice harbour area complex . There is a nice mid size mall . Not to be missed are views of the rainbow bridge and the knock off Statue of Liberty . The tour guide told me that the statue was made by those who also constructed Eiffel in Paris. Go in the late afternoon or early morning for better photo shoots , just a suggestion . By the way there is also the big Tv station tower that illuminates different colorful lights in the evening as well.

Gundam and Sega . We weren't planning to go to Odaiba as in all honestly, the pictures made it look drab and just like a big shopping complex.However, we changed our mind and decided to give Gundam an evening visit to see what it was all about -well, my (37 yr old) partner was in awe :)We watched a bit of Gundams display and then popped off for Sega Joypolis . As we got to Sega quite late, we were offered the "evening pass" . Even though we had fun, we only went on aproximately 6 or 7 games as they were either closing or closed. Because of this, I believe it would have been cheaper for us to pay separately. Also, I didn't enjoy Tokyo Ghoul and felt it was a complete waste of time -it was however quite fun being rushed through a maze by two staff shouting japanese at you (in character) about the "approaching dangers" (I don't speak japanese so it added to the authenticity for me) :)As it was really raining on our last day, we went back to Odaiba and spent probably close to 6 hours there.We went to the Gundam museum (again, my partner enjoyed it but it was too short for the money paid- although, viewing the cartoon in the dome was great -and I don't even know who Gundam is!) :)We also went to Hiro to eat the most delicious hamburger meat ever! And visited a few shops (duchess as 3 coins).It was all topped off with a view of the "statue of liberty", cherry blossom and rainbow bridge .We probably would come back as I feel we only saw the tip of the iceberg !

Worth a Day of your Life. We were there after lunch and we got a good picture view of rainbow bridge and Gundam and Fuji Television...we also did some shopping and it's seems 1 day is not enough here as there so many malls and things you can...I hope I had more time in Odaiba...till next time Odaiba
Another great stop in Tokyo. The new-ness of this place makes it feel like you are in a "future" city. Make sure to ride the ferris wheel and see the Toyota Museum

Weird place at night. This is a bit of a weird experience at night. It's basically an area where people work but don't live so it's actually eerily quiet at night - something I was not expecting anywhere in Tokyo. It's a unique experience anyway if you're looking for something a bit strange or have gotten overwhelmed at any point in your trip by the population density in Tokyo.

Tokyo Skyline. Good place to visit to take pics of Tokyo Skyline. You Can get a view of the bay, with rainbow bridge, the Tokyo Tower and the Statue of liberty. Raccomanded on evening pics. It is very windy. Behind To Fuji tv, next to Divercity Mall, you can find a 1:1 Size of a Gundam Robot

Shopping galore. I didn't really know what to expect when my husband brought us here but it was literally mall after mall. If you came to Japan to shop, this is the place. For most visitors like myself, were limited on luggage space so I couldn't shop as much as I would have wanted. Plus, a lot of the brands are Western and we can get get them at home. The massive Gundam (I think that's the name) robot outside of Divers Mall had a light show which was quite spectacular. I would stick to Divers anyway as there were the best shops there.

Fun place to visit with lots of things to do. We went to Odaiba specifically to go to the Miraikan Museum, but we ended up staying longer for the great views and the Giant Gundam. The train ride via the Yurikamome line is incredible, as it's an above ground train that goes over Tokyo Harbor. The views are wonderful, and was an added bonus to our trip to Odaiba. Once at Odaiba, there are a lot of helpful maps and signs pointing you where to go. We were only going to go for the Miraikan, but we noticed that Diver City and the Giant Gundam robot were only a short walk away from the museum. After visiting the robot we went to the harbor by Odaiba station and took in the beautiful views. This was a great place to come, I would even consider staying here for one night on a long Tokyo stay.

you wont get bored. my first day in tokyo was going in odaiba, the access was so limited, but when you get there you"ll just fell in love with the place, everybody should go here lots of malls and of course the Big Gundam Robot:)

Such a futuristic place!. Seems like I traveled to the future when I went here! Just going to Odaiba through their train without anyone operating it was already an amazing experience! Lots of things to do and places to explore here!
Odaiba - really for young families with small children. No really an interesting site for business travelers nor for couples traveling to Tokyo for pleasure.

Shopping Island. If you are looking for western malls - go there. Other than that, not very interesting or attractive, maybe nice for 2-3 hours to walk around and take some pics of the bay and other landmarks.
Want to see NY in Japan?. Haha..yes truely amazing i went there thrice an evening just to chill and walk along the bay..a day for shopping and clicks and an evening to see Odaiba illuminations...

Lot's of time needed!!. If you love shopping, you will love this place, it's basically an island of shopping malls!
It's pretty amazing, but you will lose a day easily without even realising!
There is an amazing Daiso 100Yen store in Diver City

Not as interesting as expected. There's a few shopping centers in Odaiba, out of which, I believe Aqua Diver City is the newest, and the one worth visiting more. This is the one with the huge Gundam robot. The other shopping centers have a few themed attractions such as Lego experience centre and a okotachi museum. Other than that, nothing much to rave about. There's also the Fuji tv building with the interesting architecture and a viewing gallery on top. We stayed till late to see the Rainbow Bridge. It was a let down though as the lights were not as what we saw in pictures.

Great Views, but far from many attractions. Stayed here on our last night in Tokyo. While the views are breathtaking and there an malls and restaurants where you can spend time- its not convenient to see sights in the city. Shinjuku/Shibuya are about 40 minutes on train, for example. Ginza is about 30 minutes on train, and Tsukiji Market is also about 30 minutes away. A taxi from Tokyo station took us 25 minutes and cost approximately $40USD. For sightseeing, I recommend the Ginza area!

Great place for shopping and seeing GunDam. There are many shopping malls here, including Decks that has baby stuff store 西松屋, DiverCity that has AE and Old Navy and other popular brands, Aquacity with ToysRus and BabiesRUs, and Pallette Town. We didn't have enough time to visit any of the theme "parks" such as Legoland, Wax Museum, Takoyaki museum, etc, but we will be sure to make time for a visit on our next trip!! It is a great place for rainy days and you can easily stay half or one whole day here.
Just like any other shopping center. Expensive stores and average to fast food restaurants, made for the mass of Chinese tourists, nothing to write home about.

Lots to do on this man-made island!. Lady Liberty, Toyota World, Gundam Statue, Onsen, Shopping and views... take your pick!A great way to spend a day with the attractions well spaced out from each other yet still within walking distance. Take your time at Aqua and Diver city with all the shops and cinemas. Get some fresh air outside as you stroll along the paths to the Gundam Statue and Statue of Liberty. Lots of pets on this island too... great to people/pet watch!

Shopping venue. Visit -Venus fort for Puma & Samsonite outlet-Diver city for nice photo with "GunDam" and buy "GunDam"Check out for a nice flower - tulip / Sakura - in the walkway between these two buildings

Popular tourist attraction. One of the must-visit tourist destinations in Tokyo. Opening onto the waterfront, Odaiba is very popular with foreign tourists. Plenty of entertainment throughout the day. Take a water bus for a tour of the harbor, eat a great meal, shop along the shore front. Plenty to do, even if it's only strolling through the park along the bay.

Many things to do. Odaiba is surely a great place. You can choose from going to Odaiba Seaside,watching gundam,rest in gundam cafe,go for a Palette Town,take a quick lunch in Baratie or just take a photo with blue mascot of Fuji TV.
Fun and entertaining . Fun place for the family. There are many activities for the little ones to do. The Eden was also good. There was also a Toyota attraction which is also quite interesting.
Odaiba, One Stop Attractions Places. Odaiba, Places of attractions of Diver City, Aqua City, Fuji TV Tower, Toyota Mega Web, Gundam Robot, Statue Of Liberty

Very nice at night. Very nice, especially at night ... has a lot of shopping malls where dinner or have a drink. If it is night you can enjoy views of Tokyo with all its lighting !! You must visit the viewpoint of the Fuji Television, the Statue of Liberty and the giant Ferris wheel among other things.

Gorgeous at sunset and night lights . We got there right before sunset and it was spectacular...we were on the outside of the mall walkway to view the harbor and rainbow bridge. As it got darker it the lights started to light up everywhere and was a very beautiful harbor scene.Ate at one of the restaurants. Decks. It's an Australian based restaurant with good food but pricey.It was a bit of a ride from our place in Shibuya but I really enjoyed it and thought it relaxing and worth the visit.

Beautiful and Futuristic. Taking Yurikamome line to Odaiba made me feel as if I lived in the future. I stayed the night at one of the hotels there and really enjoyed the view. The Fuji TV building was also worth the visit. I happened to be a fan of Chibi Maruko Chan so I took a lot of instant photos with Chibi theme!
It's the Gundam that's a 5*. So this is just another over priced shopping centre. But if your into Gundam then this is so worth 5* just for the novelty of seeing it for any anime fan
Nothing much. Nothing to remember about this place except the fake statue of liberty and the futuristic looking building. Shops were ok, time spent better else where
Cool spot for shoppers and arcades.. Great place for tourist, dont forget to check out the hotsprings nearby. Would love love to have to go again a second day. Lots to do.
stress reliever. love! love! love! deffo must visit place. It is very peaceful in Odaiba. The beach, sunset and the scenery. Great combination!
