Excellent place to visit with children. Odaiba is a reclaimed land island in Tokyo. There are a few malls and many things to do. Toyota has attractions and a car museum that is mostly free. The museum of emerging science and innovation is also great. There views are spectacular.

Make sure you stay till night.... Yes, Gundam, Sega, and Brooklyn Bridge (im not joking)... this is a man-made Island for only 1 purpose... tourism.. I went in the evening around 5, took a picture with Gundam, and went walking around... the LED lit Fuji building is amazing... so night view is not bad you have a mini New York....

Something different to central Tokyo!. I really liked Odaiba, we went to the science museum, Venus fort shopping centre and palette town. There's loads to do and there's also a Ferris wheel!
Would definitely recommend for a day out.
Gundam Galore!. This is the place to go to get your Gundam fix!! They offer a tour of the facility and they even have a Gundam cafe! The mall (Diver City) also has a Hello Kitty cafe!

Skyline at sunset . Something for everyone. Pleasant walk around Tokyo bay, statue of Liberty. Usual malls, cinema, ten pin bowling, amusement area. Some really great eats, recommend Bill's for a fab breakfast! The setting is pretty nice, large decks to walk around, and at sunset it is beautiful as the fairy lights and city lights come on. Not a cultural experience, but rated as a great fun day none the less. The monorail is a great way to get there, good to see the city from above ground! Recommend, and would definitely return.

Not a must see but fun. If you have several days in Tokyo this could be a nice trip one morning or afternoon. You can get the bus here or take Rinkai line but the most fun way is on Yurikamome line. Although this feels like a monorail it is not... this is a shame as they do not accept JR passes. You pay ¥320 to Dabia station but the trip over the bridge is fun. There is a hot spring place on the island and shops/museums.

Lot things to do. We went here 1 week ago, a family with kids of 7 and 5 y.o. They have a lot activities for family, like lego land, madam tussaud, ferris wheel, ninja house, and many that i forgot the names. There are also a lot place to take pictures like the miniature of liberty statue, but anyway it's not really worth it, since it is kinda mini. I think you should spend a day to explore, try to read the map first before you explore, and plan ahead what you want to see there,so you don't waste too much time,cause it is a big place.

Something different. We spent a day here, we took the train from Shinjuku and also used the monorail - that was a quest in itself! We weren't impressed with Aquacity - had a fake kind of atmosphere, and the fact that you had to pay to get into the Legoland was crazy (they have a Lego shop in Venusfort so just go there - it's free!) We like Venusfort a lot better, they had different shops to the ones that we found at the plazas and malls. Go to the Hobby trail place, lots of things to looks at. We had the best Indian food there, go to level 3, there is a little food court- looks bit dodge- but judging by all the japanese people there, it must be good. The indian restaurant, the guy there makes the naan in a traditional oven - sorry can't remember the name. The naan was soon good, we ordered 3 to have with our curries. Well priced delicious food - there were other restaurants on the other levels as well but over priced for the tourists :) We took our girls on the ferris wheel, could of spent a lot more time browsing, but the munchkins were getting tired. Was a great day out.

Good for City and museum lovers . I have visited this place in March 2016 with family and friends. For me only Rainbow bridge was worth to visit( because i don't like museum and city visiting person) . Apart from Rainbow bridge I like statue of liberty created near sea side. This place is good for a visit of 3~5 hours. Must take train to see 360 degree view of city.

Great for families, beautiful views. A highlight of our trip to Tokyo for me was the games arcade in the Decks or Aqua City shopping centre in Odaiba that was a recreation of 50s Japan. Some of the weird and wonderful family fun I was hoping to find in Tokyo that was also surprisingly cheap and cheerful! We went there a lot!

Lots of shops and a nice view. Odaiba has a large selection of shopping centres with every form of Western brand you would expect. You could spend hours going store by store if you like. We visited the Daiso to see a real Japanese Discount Store, otherwise the pricing isn't that cheap. The view of the city, Rainbow Bridge and Statue of Liberty are also worth nothing whilst at Odaiba. Not an essential visit whilst in Tokyo, but the view is definitely beautiful.

Odaiba - shoppers stop. Odaiba was our last stop on a Tokyo tour. This is meant for shoppers. The bright spot for us was that this was the only place where we were fortunate enough to see cherry blossoms. Very pretty
Amazing place!. Great place! There are shopping malls and a lot of hotels around. About 20 min from Tokyo by monorail. The monorail fees are a little more expensive that regular trains.

An unexpected assortment of shopping/beach/western-style attractions. A place to spend an enjoyable day out and a bit of cash! All your high street and high-end brand shops within a few shopping malls in this district. The beach area was lovely too.

Disappointing. Walked around this neighbourhood for a few hours and the best part is the rainbow bridge at sunset. There's also gundam statue and the mini statue of liberty but those weren't worth the trip

A nice place for views and shopping. Odaiba is more easily accessed from Tokyo Teleport station (Rinkai line) than from Yurikamome line that gets crowded sometimes. Beautiful views in the afternoon of the Rainbow Bridge and Tokyo tower. In a clear day you will be able to see the Tokyo Skytree. There is a replica of the Liberty Statue as well.There is a shopping mall and arcade in case you want to buy some souvenirs or have dinner.
lots of great place. a lot to see, a lot to do, too much things in one place. just be prepare with your legs and stamina, especially for those who are not get used with walking

Shopping Centre. Really not much more than a shopping centre with a couple of fairground like attractions. There's an aquarium and a Lego "discovery centre". What ever one of those is, so I suppose it might be OK for younger kids.

Can spend a good few hours here. We took the Skytrain to Odaiba and arrived in the late afternoon. Immediately when you leave the station you see the magnificent views of Odaiba Bay, the bridge and the little statue of liberty statue. Then walking towards Diver City Tokyo Plaza we pass the beautiful NHK TV Station Building and then see the Transformer statue, very impressive. We entered Diver City Mall and it is huge and actually full of mostly foreign tourists, although the shopping is really good. Then heading back in the evening time the buildings are all lit up nicely and the views and ambience is fantastic. Definitely a must-go to place in Tokyo.

Spectacular and wonderful. This island is a true must see while in Tokyo.
Go early, and start the day with the fantastic Onsen bath and have lunch there, then end the day with great shopping and a dinner at Venus Fort.
Plan at least one full day, and do get to the bath early to avoid the crowd.
Manmade attraction island. Spend a day there. It was connected with many malls and attraction, such as gundam lifesize statue, sega center, legoland and cinema.

Great for a spare afternoon. Artificial island plenty of stylish shopping centers.
You can see a 20metres tall robot, a liberty statue and Italy inside a building.
Worth to take the monorail to get there and enjoy the amazing views from there.

toyota museum plus others. The toyota center was fantastic. I was able to try their prototype similar to segway. There were a lot of other activites inside the center, most are free. Next door is an outlet shopping mall but somewhere inside is a museum of old vintage cars, including a ford model T. There is a big arcade called leisureland for the kids to spend time (and use up the parents money). The monorail ride to and from this place is also very unique. Ride in the front for a great view of the travel.
Nice place to go. Perfect place to walk around . Gorgeous view on Rainbow bridge. At night lots of places to go.lots of thingas to do

Have a wonderful time in Odaiba!. Odaiba, the large artificial island in Tokyo Bay is known for the place where anime fans can find the Gundam statue (at Diver City), entertainment fans can find Fuji TV, idol fans can see their favorite idol group at Aqua City or where a lot of the major anime events are located. But the location is also popular for many music events, pop culture events and more.Odaiba is one of those must-go to locations to visit, to dine, to shop and also a wonderful location for photographers to take pictures during the day and night.Back then, the location was limited to the Decks shopping area, the Fuji TV building and Sega Joypolis with nearby shops nearby. But now, the place is full of places to visit as most of the conventions happen at Tokyo Big Sight, many concerts happen in the area during the summer and really, the place is just a happening part of Japan.But now, so much has changed and I was so impressed with Odaiba. Fuji TV has a light show on their building, which was awesome to see.But Odaiba is an area you will love to visit. May it be for its events, attractions, dining, etc.

Lots of things to do, but kind of soulless.. If you're in Tokyo for a long time, Odaiba should definitely be a part of your itinerary. There are great views, the train ride over is fun, there are some fun attractions. But this is a new neighborhood on an artificial island. It has minimal character, just lots of shopping. There are so many great neighborhoods in Tokyo -- it would be a shame to blow a day on Odaiba if you're only in town for a short time. Ultimately this feels like the Pudong in Shanghai. Lots of interesting things, but a feeling like you could be kind of anywhere.

Shopping Malls and Architecture. If you're all into shopping, Odaiba is one of the places to go in Tokyo. You won't find as many "trendy" things as in places like Shibuya or Harajuku but if you like luxury brands you'll definitely get what you need here. :) Also you have a really nice view over to downtown tokyo and with the statue of liberty it even has a bit of NYC flair. ;)

Self driving train. Just the train journey itself is worth the trip to this futuristic city. Try to sit up front of the train to feel the excitement of J-tech at it's best. There are so many shops, eateries, and things to do, I'd start with the public bath and Fuji tv HQ. Give the mini Statue of Liberty a miss.

Plenty to eat and shop. There are a few big malls around Odaiba. Palette Town/Venus Fort has many outlet stores like Levi's, Zara, Franc Franc, Nike etc. Decks and Aqua City have more restaurants and cafes that overlook the Rainbow Bridge so you can plan your visit to start with the shopping and end up at Aqua City and Decks for a good meal with great views before heading back.

Great area in Tokyo. A great area to visit in Tokyo. Many shopping centers (Aqua City, Diver City), large arcades / leisure centers (Sega in Tokyo Decks, RoundOne in Diver City), a small LegoLand, Fuji TV center, a car museum (MegaWeb), huge ferris wheel, and then smaller sights such as a Statue of Liberty. Everything is in walking distance, and it's very easy to get around on foot thanks to raised walkways. Great park/beach on the bay, too, for a nice walk with beautiful scenery.Worth visiting also at night for views of Rainbow Bridge and the city all lit up.

Unexpected. We went there and didn't know what to expect. What we got was big shopping malls and an atmosphere found nowhere else in Tokyo. It looks different from anything we have seen in Tokyo and is definitely worth a visit.
Nice place to visit . A lot of thongs to see.Nove place Nice view Good location to look at tokyo bay. Day and nightAlso shoppers can have fun

Very fun place to explore and so much to do. Odaiba has so many things to do, you could spend all day there easily, theres a great view of tokyo bay, to the north of Daiba station. The fuji tv studio building looks amazing although we did not get a chance to go inside. There is a shopping mall called diver city which has so much to do including a great arcade to spend your coins in. outside diver city is a giant gundum statue which looks impressive. There is a very nice Ferris wheel, which gives you great views of the surrounding area of tokyo bay.

Loads to do great way to spend a day.. Spent a whole day here. The only down side not getting the children in to the Lego discovery centre. We were told to come back in 1 1/2 hours s ok we hung around went upstairs to the illusion gallery and that was fantastic the kids loved it. Had some ice cream then when we qent back they rold us ot was to full very disappointing. So if your told to come back think twice about it.Apart from that the day was great. Went to the big Toyota showroom which was cool. They had a 4d ride in there which the kids loved. If you have an international driving licence you can test drive the cars. We went on the big ferris wheel there were great views across to Tokyo. Just a bit scary to experience an earthquake from the top of the ferris wheel though but i guess its just anotjer day in Tokyo.Shopping was also good here. Wish we had more time to explore the shops.All in all a very good day.

Bizarre Small Manhattan just in front of Tokyo. A big Shopping with a huge Robot in the front. At time schedule it starts lightning with small show. A liberty Statue. A very beautifull view of Tokyo city. To see by day and night. Stuning buildings. A building with a mapping show with music. What else do you need?
Lively. It is a man made island. If you visit tokyo you should go there. Go to Odaiba Decks, enjoy the beach. Do not miss MIRAIKAN museum. Also Madam Tussauds is there in Odaiba.
Cool Area. Lots and lots of shopping and restaurants. This is slightly touristy, but lots of locals travel here to shop and eat.

Entertaining. Good variety of shops and restaurants. I'd recommend getting there via the monorail train from Shimbashi. Very futuristic train ride in between the business district skyscrapers and over the rainbow bridge.

Good to look around. There are many things to look around the Odaiba. There is a huge Gandamu there. You can go to Fuji TV building some parts of the building is free to look. There is Sony exploraScience . Ticket fee for adult is 500 Yen and kid for 300 Yen Cheap

Just a massive shopping mall. The best thing about the visit to Odaiba is to see a sunset over the Tokyo bridge and catch the unmanned train there and back. Odaiba itself to me is just a consumerists dream, but not much else. Admittedly there might be a few things for kids to do at Legoland but otherwise it seemed like a massive and quite empty and atmosphere-less place.

Plenty to see and do. Odaiba is a good spot for tourists. There is plenty to see and do. Lots of attractions, and plenty of shopping. The train ride to get there is good too, as you go over the bridge and get some good views of the city. The large ferris wheel is good value and worth a go as the views from the top are amazing.

What is this place?!. Seriously a waste of time. Depressing, quiet. Nothing to do. A game arcade and places to eat and the same stores you would find elsewhere in the city. The only thing I liked was the view from the metro train coming in.

Favorite place in Tokyo. Each time i visit Tokyo, i will make sure to go to Odaiba. I simply love the calmness and peaceful feelings this place gives me. There is everything in Odaiba. From entertainment to shopping. It's the best place for a leisure stroll or dates.

Not so impressed. The highlights of Odaiba were the two different transports that we took to get there and to go back to Asakusa. The Monorail and the 360 degrees curve was a nice experience. On the way back we took the Hotaluna boat, nicely designed, all the way up to Asakusa seeing the city from the water. Odaiba itself didn't impressed me much.

Love Odaiba. When in Tokyo, I always spend at least couple of hours in Odaiba. There are few good shopping malls, Toyota car showcase, The Statue of Liberty Replica, Gundam statue, and my favourite- a beautiful boardwalk along the water.

many places to visit in one area!. We went to Odaiba during our Tokyo trip and we were really happy about our afternoon stay there. The area is composed of roughly three malls, Diver City, Aqua City, and Decks. Odaiba also has Japan's replica of New York's Statue of Liberty. Very very close to the original. Being an area near the sea side, Odaiba was a really relaxing place to visit with the cool breeze and the picturesque views. In Diver City, don't forget to visit the bif gundam figure outside. You may stroll inside the mall for some good finds. We also went to Aqua City but got disappointed we did not find the restaurant I heard that served ramen from different places in Japan. Decks on the other hand has Madam Tussauds, Legoland Museum, and Takoyaki Museum. We went at the last place since it's free and you only have to buy takoyaki from one of the many stalls. Madam Tussauds and Legoland Museum both required entrance fees so we did not bother go inside anymore. Fuji Televesion Building is also found in that area. Take some photos and that's it. I think outsiders are not allowed access.

Good day and evening attraction in Tokyo. I have been here a couple of times. You can take a boat here, which is interesting in itself and once you are here, there are plenty of things to do. Dining, shopping, bath house and etc, all here.

Great place for families!. This place is awesome!I highly recommend a visit to Odaiba ^_^ it has the huge ferris wheel "daikanransha ferris wheel" and the huge GUNDAM! My fiance is a huge HUGE fan of Gundam so this was definitely a dream come true for him.Theres the theme park, gundam front tokyo, and divercity. Tons and tons of things to do and see, doesn't help there is a huge mall as well. We literally spent half our day here. It's about a 30-45min train ride from Shinjuku but the view is amazing =). There is a huge arcade there where a bunch of students go to hang out and chill, they dress up in anime characters too and go all out! It's pretty cool.You don't need to buy tickets in advance, can definitely purchase tickets there and it will be cheaper! Odaiba is super family oriented and kid friendly so a great places if you are on a trip with your kids =).

Must visit place. I always visit odaiba when i went to Tokyo Japan. Its like futuristic city with many attractive spots like mini liberty statue, seaside park, aqua city, madamme tussaud and some shopping centre around. In mid march also can seeing blossoming sakura in here. If you visiting Tokyo, this place is one spot that you must visit.

Must go. I went to odaiba 3 times during my stay in Tokyo. There's simply so much to do/see that you can't do it in one day.
I recommend taking the Ferris wheel at night, the view is amazing (including rainbow bridge).
Also perfect for shopping! But don't expect a good level of English!

Kinda 90s atmosphere. I had high expectations about Odaiba but we were really disappointed: it's a hassle to walk from a spot to another, the Innovation museum had a very 90s atmosphere, and the Italian-style mall was tacky (not in the good way). The train to go there was nice though!

So worth a visit!. This place is great! Palette Town (a shopping mall), Mega Web (Toyota car showcase), a Ferris Wheel, Amusement Centre, The Statue of Liberty Replica, Joypolis, Gundam statue, a beautiful boardwalk along the water, restaurants, Legoland, The Museum of Emerging Science (see Asimo the robot) Spend all day here, such a fun place!

Odaiba, a must see in Tokyo. Odaiba is a reclaimed land area located next to Tokyo bay. A wide range of sites ranging from the Toyota mega showcase to hi tech arcades, a Italian themed mall, Aqua City,Giant Gundam robot, mini statue of liberty, Fuji TV and observatory sphere to name a few. The Toyota showcase had new Toyota cars on display as well as a free car museum with many classic cars. You can even ride newer Toyota cars around a track that travels through and outside the building. Outside there is a giant Ferris wheel to ride as well. The giant Gundam robot is impressive even for those not into the anime. It really looks like a working machine. There are a few malls in Odaiba and they all offer a huge amount of dinning choices and interesting shops. There are a few arcades with very unique games and one of the biggest is run by Sega. You can sit in a real Dodge Viper car while racing on a screen in front. The car is on hydraulics and moves while playing. The best way to visit Odaiba is to plan to stay until evening. Tokyo harbor and Rainbow bridge look amazing at night along with the neon lit party cruisers dotting the water. So much to see and do for everyone.

Outlet shops. Snowed today and then heavy rain so changed original plan and headed indoors. Went to Venus Fort which is 3 floors of outlet stores, in an Italian styled mall - lots of well known shops and my wife got a great deal at Zara. Then went next door to Toyota exhibition - well worth it especially with two teenage boys. Lots of games and things to look at even if you are only mildly interested in cars. Kept us busy for a couple of hours. Finally did ferris wheel - nice way to relax after rushing around and good way to get a look at the Odaiba area. Great 4-5 hours.

Beautiful Place! Must Visit!. Odaiba is a must-visit area! It is a bay with walking access from the main tokyo island over the Rainbow Bridge which lights up at night. A day wouldnt be enough to explore everything! I have been here twice, first to an expo in Tokyo Big Sight in 2012. Coming back in 2016 just for sightseeing, there are factory outlets in Venus Forts, Toyota Megaweb, Sega Joypolis theme park, giant Ferris Wheel. In addition to that there are Divercity shopping mall where you can see a life sized gundam statue and purchase sovenirs. We didnt get to visit everything as time was limited, I would love to visit the onsen, museum of emerging science too in future. We came in January, so it was the end of winter sale and almost everything was heavily discounted(winterwear).

Worth it if you have lots of time in Tokyo. Odaiba is fun, there is a huge variety of activities for all ages. The malls have lots of western shops, Sega Joyapolis is fun for video game type entertainment, Madam Tussauds, the Museum of Technological Innovation, TV studio tours, etc. That said, I am not sure I would make it a priority if I had a limited time in Tokyo. We have been several times in our 3 years in Japan but if I were here for a week or two I wouldn't allocate a day to Odaiba.

All sorts for all types. Odaiba has all sorts for all people, shopping, amusements, theme park rides, boardwalk, park, kites, maritime museum, TV museum, observation deck the list goes on.Check it out, plan the day, get here early and have fun.

Always love coming back to Odaiba!. My Fiance and I love Odaiba for many reasons, and we highly recommend it to anyone coming to Tokyo for the first time. The couple of cons about the Island is that it can be relatively expensive to travel there compared to other areas on the mainland, and it possesses few 'traditional' Japanese sites. But otherwise, it is amazing for shopping and having fun. In particular, we love going to Diver City shopping centre and Leisureland in Pallette Town to play the UFO games/machines. LOTS of fun! I also recommend the Ferris Wheel on a clear day as it gives you a beautiful view of Tokyo. As someone who is scared of heights, it was pretty frightening for me, but I just held on (it is very slow which was my issue!) and focused on what I could see instead :) We also enjoy walking through the Toyota Megaweb- a must for any Toyota or car fan. The Shopping in Diver City is good with a variety of mid to high range stores. We also recommend venturing into the Decks shopping centre and checking out the buffet (during lunch or dinner peak hours, otherwise food is cold) and the nick nack stores that have anime merchandise and treat boxes. Overall a fun location that is easy to walk around. I also recommend going to the Maritime Museum in Odaiba to find out more about the Island's history!We're looking forward to returning to Odaiba next time we come to Tokyo!

Reclaimed land with great planning and pleasure to deal with. New area of Tokyo. Stayed at Hilton locally. Shopping malls with great bargains with most of the large chains. Great access to large food areas made them worth a visit. Parks, Bay runs, opens space, a building of great architecture that had a light show of window lights to music every night..fantastic. Area of innovation museum which is well worth visiting

18 Meter RX-78-2 Gundam is the Coolest Statue Ever Made. just the gundam statue worth all the expenditure cost by yurikamome line
diver city plaza is not a bad place too, just too hot inside

Worth spending a day there. Lots to see there, the replica of the Statue of Liberty, a giant Gundam robot, Rainbow Bridge, Shopping Malls, open areas, a ferris wheel, nice views of the city before and after sunset, restaurants, indoor attractions for kids and teenagers,etc.; It's a fun and entertaining atmosphere.There is a shopping mall there (where the ferris wheel is), its ceiling has been painted in a way that it looks like the perfect blue sky, similar to to the Venetian in Vegas.Odaiba is a must if you are in Tokyo.

Good area for the young crowd. It is a little far from the city center. My husband and I took the JR train here, and it took about 30 minutes from Shibuya (not including the time to figure out the transfers). Come at home for the best view of the statue of liberty, the transformer statue, and the Tokyo tower, and the bridge. Recommend to shop at the Diver City Mall while visiting Odaiba. Many shops are tax free for foreign travelers (make sure you bring your passport! Without a passport, one will not get tax free privilege).
Wonderful shopping experience. So many entertaining places to go for children and adult......dog's lover must visit Venus Fort level 1.

Well worth the trip. It is worth going to Odaiba just for the train ride through Tokyo above ground and over the Rainbow Bridge. Most of the time our travelling was done underground so this trip showed a new perspective of the city. Once there we took a walk on the beach to give us a viewpoint over Tokyo in one direction and Odaiba in the other, the kids played some arcade games and we did a bit of souvenir shopping. We noticed Madame Tussaud's wax works and Legoland were here too, but didn't visit. Well worth the trip.

My favorite place in Tokyo. If you have even just a couple of days in Tokyo, you should definitely visit Odaiba. It's an artificial island facing amazing Tokyo skyline, Tokyo bay and the Rainbow bridge.In my opinion, the best way to get to Odaiba is by the Yurikamome Monorail: the automatic train with no driver, which travels from Shimbashi station. You can wait for a new train and get the best seats in front of the car. Get off at either Odaibakaihinkoen or Daiba. There's an amazing viewpoint, a small statue of liberty, great beach and park, shopping, restaurants, and great fururistic architecture. The best time is right before sunset: great view and you can see the city light up slowly while the sky gets dark.Highly recommend this place!
Great light shot and city view . Winter illuminations are amazing here. Esp they put a laser show over Nha building and any season this has great city views.
Love it . There is something about Odaiba that makes you want to come back. It is great for shopping. It has a relaxing and fun atmosphere. The train ride to Odaiba is nice.
Good views.. Great views, good photos. Modern area, shopping malls only, Affordable shopping. Avoid the Hilton Hotel.
Awesome!. Awesome place to visit!came here with my wife on 2013,alot of shopping area and restaurant nearby.Definitely a must visit place.

Paris-New York-London - Tokyo all at one place !. I have visited Odaiba during my trip to Japan in November 2015 ! It is a must visit place while in Tokyo. The train ride from Tokyo city center to Odaiba was amazing ! A Beautiful man made Island in Tokyo !!You can see many world heritage sights replicas like Eiffel Tower,London Bridge , Statue of liberty located here. Amazing picture perfect postcard it is !! There are many hotels in this area and I would strongly suggest to stay here while in Tokyo.

Fun place for children. This is the best place to go if you have children. A lego land, anime stuff, a big carousel, a replica of the Statue of Liberty, plenty of shopping both for kids and adults, a Toyota Museum and best of all the giant Gundam Robot

Shopping Paradise with lots of things to do. Odaiba is a must see when you're in Tokyo. The train ride alone is so enjoyable.This place is not just for shopping, eating and fun. There are lots to see. The views are simply gorgeous. The statue of liberty, rainbow bridge and gundam statue to name a few.At night, Odaiba comes alive with lights from the rainbow bridge and Fuji TV network building. It's simply impressive and definitely one of my highlight in Tokyo.

A Day at Odaiba… wouldn’t be enough!. There just so many things to do and many interesting places to visit, hence a day at Odaiba wouldn’t be enough. And for those who would like to contemplate, this place also offers a great view of the Rainbow Bridge as well as a closer encounter of a smaller scale Statue of Liberty. And if you’re a big spender and would like to spend on itsy bitsy and teeny weeny kind of things, the Aqua City offers five floors of shopping ground with so many restaurants and shops to choose from. Lastly, don’t let your curiosity kill you since this place has a science museum that features latest and futuristic technologies by Sony. And should your feet get tired and seeks to relax, a cinema complex is available to accommodate that need.
Lego land for kids. Though not much of a surprise, the LEGOLAND in one of the shopping mall there helps keep kids occupied or sweat out for 2-3 hours when adults may take a break.

THE place to be if you have young children, especially boys!. We took our 4yr and 6yr old sons to Odaiba and enjoyed sitting on the Ferris Wheel, admiring Gundam, and most of all the indoor Legoland! Best of all the place is frequented by locals and tourists but not crazy crowded like Disneyland.Would recommend to all our parent friends with young kids like us.
Nice area, but not the "real" Tokyo. This is a tourist area, so there is a lot to do and see but if you're looking for more authentic Tokyo experiences, go elsewhere.

Fun experience at Odaiba. I went there on a slightly rainy day. The ride on the Daiba Express to Odaiba was pretty nice and Odaiba itself is also definitely worth seeing. I especially enjoyed the Fuji TV headquarters and also went into some malls/shopping centers to escape the rain. Overall, it was definitely a nice experience!

spend all day or more in odaiba. Beautiful ride on the monorail to reach Odaiba. Lots of shopping malls, discount malls, amusement park, fake beaches (swimming not allowed), statue of liberty replica, and an osen. Do a little research before you go to prioritize things you like to do. Or just wandering around is fun too.

Perfect place to relax and enjoy even in cold weather. Was still a bit chilly and not the crowd we are used to in the summer time, but we love the shops, the friendly crowd and the food selection is fantastic... You must visit this place if you are ever in Tokyo

Odaiba has it all. Odaiba should be in your must visit list. There are lots of things to do here: shopping, park/garden, amusement park, beach, port, museum, onsen, building attractions, and many more. Looking at the map, the main area is divided into 2 major parts: east and west. East area is mainly tokyo big sight, disaster museum center, water museum, Panasonic centre, etcWest area got more attractions and things to do such as: 1.Fuji TV bldg - observation deck (you can see Mt.Fuji if sky is clear)2. Aquaport+Decks Tokyo Beach - Joypolis, Madame Tusaud, Legoland, Sony explora science museum, 3. Pallete Town - Giant sky wheel, Leisure Land, 4. Toyota mega web and mini driver5. Oedo onsen monogatari6. Museum of emerging science and innovation7. Diver City Plaza - Gundam statueThere is a free shuttle bus covering the west area, it stops at: Aomi st, National museum of emerging science, wangan studio, pallette town, tokyo teleport station, diver city plaza, hotel nikko, aquacity, Fuji TV and grand pacific le daiba.Don't forget to check attraction's main website to see if they are open/close. You need at least 2 days to cover Odaiba, spending a night at hotel in Odaiba would be nice as some hotel provide free shuttle to several location.

A Must Visit When in Japan. If there is a place I will definitely visit in my next trip in Japan, this is one of them. A great view of the ocean, lots of attractions, great malls, nice restaurants, great shopping deals, a replica Statue of Liberty and plenty of other things to do. You can spend your entire day in this area and leave wanting for more time.

Lots of shopping. Nice play to go around for shopping, pictures especially at night and also kids activities. Lots of restaurants also, both gourmet and a food court for those on a budget. Easily accessible by monorail.

Great family outing option!!. Our biggest disappointment was that almost all attractions are closed in Tokyo from 27th of Dec to 1st of Jan. Well, Odaiba was one of a few options left for us and it didn't disappoint either!!! You need to cone there early. The family ride on the highest ferry wheel in the world for only ¥3,080 is a great start of the day. Also Ride Studio that is next door to the ferry wheel entrance is a must one for the little ones. Kids up to 6 years old drive for free, older ones pay ¥300 for training and ¥200 to get their licence, our kids absolutely loved that, but you need to queue early to make a reservation. Toyota Mega Web is full of entertainment including full size human robot, lots of new cars on free access display and simulator ride experience in a small theater that runs 20mins. Don't need to mention Venus Fort and shopping, we loved it all!!!
Lots of things to do. the man made island has many things to do. from sight seeing to shopping. where are many shopping malls and a car museum.

Visit Oedeo Onsen . If you like onsens and don't want to travel out of Tokyo to experience them, Odaiba has a big public Onsen called Oedeo Onsen which has many indoor and outdoor baths, gender separated. Entry is 2,880 yen during peak hours. There are also lots of shopping and food on the island but I find better and more convenient options in other parts of Tokyo.

Beautiful night lights and Rainbow bridge. A must-go to place for tourists. Just a short 15min bus ride from Shinagawa station (near hotel) and there is Joypolis Sega City, Aqua City there for the kids to go wild.

Activities, shopping and restuarants.. Toyota museum, Gundam, Rainbow bridge, shopping, restaurants, relaxing via the pier with a drink or simply having a good run/jog. There's something for everyone.

one of the nicest areas in Tokyo. Ideal place to spend a couple of days' vacation with a lot of things to see all at walkable distance... also a shoppers paradise with so many shopping malls, so many restaurants at this extremely beautiful place.
Impressive man-made island!. The atmosphere was lovely, loved the Statue of Liberty and the giant robot, there is a lot of entertainment facility at the area and easily accessible by the railway.

Reminds of Singapore. This is I think the newest 'wing' of modern Tokyo. The coolest thing here is the train that crosses the bridge with the cars. This reminds me of Singapore - new malls, modern skyscrapers and attractions with nothing to worry about from transportation to security. It has something to offer to everyone who visits this place. Just be ready to walk around as this place is really huge and buildings are a bit far from each other BUT the scenery around is relaxing enough as a drawback to long walks. I wonder how this place will look like 3-5 years from now. Definitely will go back here.

Futuristic Tokyo. We loved everything about Odaiba! Follow an easy walking tour from japan-guide.com and you'd have visited all the major attractions in odaiba. Get off at daiba station and have fantastic ramen at the food fair on the 5th floor of aquacity mall. We also had grilled wagyu from a street vendor just in front of gundam statue in diver city. Teens and car enthusiasts would definitely enjoy a visit to the toyota mega web which is directly connected to aomi station of the yurikamome line.

Vibrant, modern artificial island. An interesting place in Tokyo. Shopping malls, hotels, auto show, museum, a copy of Liberty statue, and beautifully designed landscaping with many things to enjoy! We had so fun in this place which are difficult to explain. Once is not enough.

New area of Tokyo, great for shopping & dining. It's a new area of Tokyo, great for shopping & dining. There are several shopping malls in this area. Easily accessible by trains. Also very close to Tokyo Disney Land and Disney Sea.

Still amazing concept and amazing experience. Still amazing concept and amazing experience worth the trip specially from dawn. crossing the rainbow and bathing at the public sauna and shopping areas are MUST. ENJOY

Beautiful and Yet Modern Front of Tokyo. This area of Tokyo was a place to deter outside attack during the Edo Period of Japan. However, it is now one of the most visited place in Tokyo. You will need to take Yurikamome from Shimbashi Station to reach here. (Unless you have decided to swim here)There are so much to see in here - Aqua City, Rainbow Bridge, Diver City Tokyo Plaza (big Gundam), Venus Fort, Statue of Liberty Odaiba Version, Decks Beach, Fuji Tower Center and Telecom Center etc. There is a nice observation deck beside Aqua City, right beside Statue of Liberty in there, which allows a beautiful view of Rainbow Bridge with Tokyo Tower as backdrop. And... most importantly, it is free!
nice building. easy to access by train. you can take picture of the modern bridge and nice building. you also can find Disney shop at 1 of the mall.

Worth a visit and a stop for night pictures of Tokyo. I went twice whilst in Tokyo as I stayed in Japan for weeks.It's alright, one gets the feeling is not real and that does not have a soul of I must be honest but there are nice things to do.I like the Toyota museum (interactive exibits too if you speak Japanese). The Venus Fort shopping centre has some outlet/ discount stores where I did quite a bit of shopping.My favourite part though was going at night. I stopped at Odaibakaihinkoen station on the Yurokamone elevated line (walk towards Deck). There is a beach there with a bar and more shops/ restaurants and good viewing spots to enjoy the Rainbow bridge and Tokyo at night.
Ordinary visit. Nothing extra ordinary. The basic mall can offer. Shopping, supermarket, cafes etc.Worth spending half a day here. Alight at Odaiba stn.

Will I stay here again? My answer is NO. We stayed here thinking it is near Haneda Airport and we needed to catch a morning flight home. The first airport bus starts around 8am. If the train fails to function , we will not be able to reach the mono rail station. Staying here is like being imprisoned in an island.We spent the whole day shopping to our hearts content. Of course it will not be able to replace Shibuya or Shinjuku. So we will not be staying here again.

Quiet part of town across the river. Good place to stay/visit if you want a bit of space away from the hustle and bustle of central Tokyo. Nice riverside location (you can get here by boat or tram). There are three malls and museums and parks.

Historic artificial island with modern buildings. We travelled here via the driver-less train across the Rainbow Bridge from Tokyo station and spent about a day in Odaiba. From the interesting architecture of the Tokyo Big Sight and Fuji TV station, modern interactive Miraikan Science Museum and Panasonic Centre, kitschy Oedo Onsen theme park and Joypolis arcade, our one day trip to Odaiba was well worth it. To cap it off we had a nice stroll along the boardwalk of Decks Tokyo Beach and Aqua City taking in the beautiful night view of Rainbow Bridge and scale copy of the Statue of Liberty.Other attractions that we didn't have enough time for include Madame Tussauds, Maritime Museum and Gundam at Palette Town.
Very cool architecture !. Cool nebourhood , modern architecture, shooing malls, restorants , there is something for everyone, beautiful viewof the bay and rainbow bridge !

Made for foreigners to go shopping, but the Giant Gundham made it worth the trip. Odaiba is ok and is good for a nice walk, but it doesn't feel like what I consider the real Japan that I love. It is still good to go if you want to shop and have no Japanese language ability, but I think it is a little gimmicky and boring for my tastes. If you are short on time I think you can have much more fun around Asakusa or Tokyo Station. To make it more fun you can walk across the rainbow bridge on your way there!

All rounder. Odaiba is an all rounder. It has shopping, some museums, things to see, places to eat, even a little beach! The Gundam Wing statue is there if you are a fan with animated shows to see.Odaiba has some small festivals every so often, so check one of those out.
Family oriented day trip. This place has something for everyone. Numerous museums, several malls, and tourist attractions. Visit with friends or family.

Modern city in modern Tokyo . It is not an historical area. A big city in Tokyo. Not a place for one day. Shopping malls, amusement parks, showrooms, beaches, ...If your visit is more than a week in Tokyo, I strongly recommend you to go there.If weather is good pass the rainbow bridge by walk.

Sega & Gundam - Japanese theme park. This place was not on my list initially but everyone I met and spoke to in Japan (hotel staffs, waiters & waitresses) recommended it, so we came her, making a big mistake of purchasing daily unlimited tickets. Frankly, a cheaper 2 ways ticket is sufficient, ride the train, take a round trip to the last station and back to the station you wish to see is the most comfortable way to take a glimpse of this island since most of the 'actions' are close by Daiba station, all within walking distance. Came with high expectations and left disappointed, but my kids loved it. My girl called it the Japanese theme park, an better alternative to Disney Land and Sea ( she refused to revisit Tokyo Disney which we visited once years ago). The old fashioned arcade at Decks with some vintage stuffs was most interesting to me. Rainbow bridge, 'statue of liberty' and the Christmas illuminations were nice at night and we could see Tokyo Tower from here too. But that's it...Toyota Mega Web, Venus Port, Fuji TV and Diver City - worth a visit? Maybe great for kids and shopaholics, but not for me.

A good place for family activities. There is an artificial beach, an elevated pedestrian boardwalk with view of the Rainbow Bridge and Statue of Liberty, shopping malls ( Venus Fort is nice ) with restaurants and indoor theme parks, statue of Gundam and a Ferries Wheel.We took the Yurikamome ( one Day Pass 820 yen ) from Shimbashi and got off at Daiba station to see the Winter Illuminations. The place is very pedestrian friendly ( The traffic is below )
Great part of Tokyo. Loved being in Tokyo, but just outside. So much to to on the island of Odaiba when you want to spent a day on this side of the Rainbow Bridge.
Perfect for family visit. This part of the city is perfect for families with children. In my case not very convenient but next time ill visit with my family.

Great area with lots of shopping malls and great hotels. Full entertainment complex for the whole family. Odaiba is located a little far from Tokyo Center, but easy to access via train (about 20min) and full of things to do. We spent 2 days full just to explore Toyota Mega Web, AquaCity (there's Legoland Discovery and Sega Joypolis inside), Diver City (famous for 18m Gundam statue and great choice of foodcourt area), Venus Port (European style mall with renowned local and international brands). Good area if you're into shopping or travelling with kids.
visited the Miraikan. my pre teens didnt really enjoy the museum... i personally only liked the 10 min show of the robot. particularly like the 7floor lounge as well for a great view of Tokyo

Great center of positive energy. I spent one Saturday night in the area, easily accessible by the Yurikamome which is a treat in itself doing a unique victory lap of the beautiful Tokyo Bay.Odaiba area has many, many easily accessible eateries, shopping areas and fine hotels all strung together with interlocking spacious walkways.The already impressive views of Rainbow Bridge, Liberty Statue were augmented by the December illumination, a whole building with Christmas lights dancing to music and a fireworks display!...and I only spent a few hours there.

Good for some shopping and views, but that's about it. This was a nice break from the craziness of central Tokyo. The malls are okay and have a decent selection. For American tourist, you might find the selection of shops very familiar with home, which can be good or bad, depending on what you're looking for. If you do it for anything, go around sunset for the views. It was lovely.
Shopping paradise. Take your time and enjoy all this place has to offer. Take the subway over but catch the ferry back for a different view.

Odaiba. nice area, you can get to the island by train (great ride, nice view and affordable) or by boat.you can find there:shopping malls, arcades, Ferris Wheel, restaurants, classic cars,tv building,small statute of liberty , nice bridge, giant gundam robot and many more...i have been there at nigh, when everything is Lighted.

Open space in Tokyo . Main objective is to visit the onsen there. Well it did pay off. It was a great onsen that caters to the family. There are 3 outdoor pools for the men section and a few indoor pools as well.After your onsen session you can enjoy a relaxing time or some good food at the huge food court designed in Japanese style..Odaiba offers 3 - 4 large shopping centres, namely Diver City, Aqua City and 2 other large shopping complexes. Tokyo "Eye" is also located here.

A Satellite Shopping Mall. I liked the location -- an island literally, Took a monorail to get there. Open, by the bay, and many shops and restaurants. A nice change from the ginza and shinjuku areas.

Fun and Relaxation. Nice Shopping Malls ( one with Rainbow Bridge view, one behind the Ferris Wheel called Venus Fort) Great choice of Restaurants for ALL Budgets, Replica of Lady Liberty,Beach walk, Free Gandam Giant Robot Show,Classic Cars Show AND new Toyota Vehicles Displayed. My personal FAVORITES are OEDO Onsen and Ariake Tennis/Concerts arena.

Lots of shopping buildings. Didn't cover much of this area as time are short before our transfer to another hotel further away from here. But apparently there are definitely be places to see and shop.

Lots to see and do for everyone. Shops, attractions, sights.....I took the metro to Tokyo Teleport station. The big wheel was right outside. I visited River City shops to get a break and use their free WiFi. A broad range of shops and eating places to choose from.Great views of the city from hereI visited the mini Statue of Liberty, the giant transformer figure, the National Maritime Museum even though it was closed - it looks like a full size ship.The buildings here are very futuristic
It's like a holiday park. Loved it, the craziness, the 'over the top' shops and attractions. Would recommend it if Tokyo isn't crazy enough for you.

Super fun for family!. My son loved riding the train to Odaiba...that in itself is super fun! Up and over the Rainbow Bridge. Make sure you know which stop to get off at...we didn't and it was a tad confusing to say the least. There are so many different places/things to do including an Onsen! We hit Palette Town where you will find MegaWeb and one of the biggest Ferris Wheels in the world with views over all of Tokyo (we did it after dark...even more fun!)

Great Place. The rainbow bridge is a fantastic view with the 'statue of liberty' in front...The shopping place - Aquacity is also big and nice to walk around. The Decks has the Madame Tussaud to visit..so many activities ...The railway train is also slightly different from Metro subway or JR lines trains.Basically ...you need at least a day to cover the whole area. I only had 4 hours ..and definitely not enough.
Great for teens. Sadly we didnt' get to see as much as wanted here, weather was windy and rainy-we spend a lot of time in Joypolis which was a huge hit for the teens -admittedly I had a blast also.
Another must vist in Tokyo. Odaiba offers too many nice places to visit and discover new experiences. Easy to access by both train and ferries.

Great. First day in japan we went by boat from asakusa to Odaiba.Huge and very spacey to walk around.Saw the huge gundam statue.Went on the ferris wheel and stopped off at the arcade hall there.Great day trip.Bonus tip:Gundam statue is more awesome to see at night.

THE RAILWAY IS VERY UNIQUE !. 1. We use train accomodation from tokyo station to reach odaiba and we got suprised because usually the railway were underground or on land. The train from tokyo to odaiba use a railway way up on a bridge2. You can see the rainbow bridge on the way to Odaiba3. Odaiba is the new harbour for Tokyo, Japan4. Toyota build a new buildiing near by and sold a rare sparepart5. Also a mall with a huge gundam 6. Visit at night. The lightning tech were very pretty

Hi tech fun. Getting to the Odaiba area on the river boat cruise is just half the fun. Take it from the Asukasa area and get off at Odaiba. Plan to spend a good part of the day walking around the sights and shopping at various stores. There are loads of restaurants at all prices. Even Lady Liberty has her place on the island.

Recommended for the Rainbow Bridge and the Statue of Liberty. There's a fairly big mall with a ferris wheel. Expensive shops, some good restaurants. However, I recommend visiting this place in the evening/night just to see the Rainbow Bridge and the Statue of Liberty. There's an impressive view of Tokyo and it only costs you the subway ticket (+ probably one station with the Tokyo Monorail in between).

huge & awesome place. it was my first time visit during my second time holiday in tokyo. it was a huge shopping area, alot of attraction area. recommended for a family trip. got a gundam and liberty statue. better take a whole day to look all the areas.

Soulless dystopia. You feel tiny as you crawl among the corporate giants' show houses. There are few shops and places to rest, and you walk a long, long way. Perhaps some people find the open spaces airy and novel, for others its a prime example of poor urban planning.

Awesome part of Tokyo. Access Odaiba either by river boat (expensive) or the Yurikamome monorail line which you can catch outside Shimbashi station (super-cheap). You can even use your PASMO card on the monorail. We loved Odaiba and went there twice. Its a lot more relaxed and open than the rest of Tokyo which is refreshing. We missed out on so much stuff here (Miraikan, Onsen bath, Ferris wheel, Toyota Megaweb, etc) but we did visit the Fuji-TV building which has great views, Madame Tussauds in the Decks complex (a huge shopping mall) and Joypolis. Joypolis is an indoor theme park and we went in after 5pm so got the cheaper night ticket which is all you really need. Being indoors, its not huge like Disneyland but there are a number of rides and we really enjoyed it. We also ate (twice) at the Dog Dept Cafe on the harbour side of the Decks complex and while not cheap, the food was great although not authentic japanese, more japanese blended western style. However, as the name suggests, this is a cafe where owners can take their dogs and the dogs have their own menu to order from. We thought it was really cool but others may disagree. You can also buy clothes for your pooch here as well as yourself although prices are high. We caught the glass topped water taxi from Odaiba to Asakusa but felt it was expensive and not really worth the trip, the monorail was our favourite method of getting to Odaiba.

Man-made Island. This man-made island has been revamped during the last 2 decades. Spectacular journey by underground (private line, higher prices) best visited on a sunny day . If it's rainy OK for shopping and museums.

Nice lovely place. I think Odaiba is worth visiting. It has many interesting attractions within it and great for shopping ! There's a massive arcade as well if you enjoy those types of things. The Fuji TV building was really cool to see also.

Alone beside Rainbow bridge. I was planned it's lazy day,I went many place before take a relaxing in here. So it's small island that's you can travel by walk and use train,very easy travel by yourself. Good luck.

Nice place. Many happy couples around where you can have romantic moments.Good place with good leisure spots.Restaurants with good fresh sushi bars.Clean neighborhood.One of the best place in Tokyo to have a calm weekend.

Great shopping location!. If you are looking for a place to spent a whole day going from mall to mall, visit an amusement park, go on a Ferris wheel, catch an exhibition at the museum of emerging science and innovation ( great place if you want to see real Japanese robots), see the statue of liberty( albeit smaller than the original) or a Gundam Robot ( in real size) deliver a light show. Then this is the place to go. If you like cars, you can go to the to Toyota mega web, a show room for new and old cars, this also includes a testing area for prototypes. Definitely worth a visit.
The decks. Defo come here, for the Rainbow Bridge view, it is simply wonderful, have a walk on the decks, try some coffee, stroll along the artificial beach, I came here twice, it was so worth it.

Good Place to Spend an Afternoon. We didn't get to see everything on Odaiba but we certainly had a great time there. There's something for everyone in the family even the pets there from shopping to gaming to eating. We were surprised to notice that one section of the shopping mall seemed to be overrun with people wheeling their pets in strollers and prams. That particular section was geared to the pet owners. Part of the mall is modelled after an old European city and is particularly beautiful with its high painted ceilings made to look like the sky.The ferris wheel is fun if you're not scared of heights and gives a great view of the area.There is a huge Toyota display area and a large collection of old cars and even tiny model ones as well. They are really displayed in an attractive way and I enjoyed seeing them even though I'm not really an automobile enthusiast.It's a great place to go if you have various ages in your group. Everyone will find something to do and be happy with food choices.

Perfect sunset!. Odaiba it's the perfect choice if you want to enjoy your spare time in Tokyo, large shopping areas, the Fuji tv building , green areas , good restaurants and coffe shops and quite important! The best view that you can have from Tokyo bay, highly recommended to photograph the Sunset watching the rainbow bridge and Tokyo skyscrapers in the background, don't forget to visit the giant Gundam in front of the Diver city!!

Killing Time. I visited Odaiba with my two adult sons and one of then wanted to see the Gundam in front of the DiverCity Mall. We caught the Yurikamome Rail from Shimbashi and gt off at Odaiba City stop. We then crossed over the bridge and took the wide paved walk to the Divercity Mall.Inside the Mall, we came across a huge food court that was full of people eating. In the food court, there were a lot of different types of food to eat, but we had already eaten our lunch so we just looked and passed on through.We went up to several of the shops in the upper floors of the mall and I bought some chocolate mocha and some cookies for my co-workers to try. They must have good, as the omiyage did not last very long at work.We were quite tired, since we had just come from the Ueno Zoo and Ameyahocho Street, so we headed back to Shibuya. The Yurikamome rail is a little smaller than any of the JR or Toei line trains, so the cars appear to be more crowded. I was surprised to see so many people on the train at 2:00pm in the afternoon. I think we should have stayed longer in Odaiba, but we were tired and we didn't have to do any shopping. I can see how people can spend an entire day there and not get bored, as it is a pretty amazing place to visit.

Shop till you drop. The Yurikamome monorail ride to Odaiba offered some nice views of Tokyo (especially at night). Lots of shops and malls - DiverCity being the biggest, with AquaCity just across the street. Nice waterfront promenade with a great night view of Tokyo and Rainbow Bridge!

good place to shop and see Gundam. if u want to see a lot of gundam toys. visit divers city. my kids loved it there because its not only for gun dam lovers. there is also hello kitty shops and café the miki (hello kitty café)

Weird And Wonderful . On a very rainy day we thought shopping would be fun so Odaiba it was. An easy train trip with one change at Shimbashi station. We got off at Odaiba which lands you at Aqua City but you can also get off at Aomi which takes you to the front entrance of Venus Fort shopping centre. We went to Venus and it was good. Plenty of shops all indoors. A good food court too. Just a tip, if you are a big guy there isn't much for you to buy. Even the shoes dont go past 44

We almost skipped this but ended up here twice in the end.. Odaiba is a man mad island in Tokyo bay you can get to by train (either over or under the water). We were told the over water train was quite expensive but we ultimately took both and didn't see a huge price difference and would therefore recommend going over the bay for the view at least once if you're headed out that way. We decided to head to Odaiba for the robot museum (Miraikan) but ended up staying (and returning) for the trick art museum (pretty cool photos here but not worth just walking around without a camera), the ferris wheel (one of the biggest in the world), the toyota showcase (if you have an international drivers license you can test drive toyotas we don't even have for 300yen on their cool track and they also had cars from around the world, historical galery and a look at some of the cars they have prototypes of) and the shopping. Over all it's not "must see Tokyo" and with less time we would have skipped it but there is a lot of cool touristy things to do out that way. You can also get a picture of their replica of the statue of liberty with the tokyo tower in the background (which looks a lot like the eiffel tower) which may confuse people back home about where you actually went.

Shops galore . So many shops and shopping malls. You have it all here. Food, clothes, watches, glasses. Everything. If you don't see it here you don't need it. Take your credit card and watch the mrs like a hawk. ;-)

high tech shopping. Lots os malls and shops and lots selling high tech gear a lot of which wont work in the uk so beware and check you purchases first. Although noce to see the malls are simialr to those all over tokyo and if short of time i would give this area a miss.

Not recommended for a Tokyo visitor. Odaiba may be an escape from the noise of the city for Tokyo for its residents, but for international travelers there is absolutely no reason to take time away from visiting authentic Tokyo neighborhoods to visit Odaiba. It's a man-made monstrosity, borrowing from all of the worst aspects of post-war cities. Shopping malls, wide streets, pedestrian-unfriendly. If you enjoy suburbia and car-culture this may be for you.

Wonderful Place in Japan for outing. Odaiba is wonderful place to visit in Japan. It is well connected from Tokyo. Try to make monorail to reach there as it will take you inside the rainbow bridge which itself is very awesome. You can find shopping malls, Madame Tussauds, statue of liberty replica. Recommended if you are going to Japan

Sony museum of high technology , mid range shopping mall and other interesting things. Odaiba is an island not very far from central Tokyo . We changed 2 trains and took us about 30 min to rich there . It's an artificial island with shopping mall ,big car showroom , Sony high tech museum , restaurants , planetarium . It's a place for having fun . In case you want to visit the planetarium , check the poems get hours and days . I remember that it was off on Monday or Tuesday . The shopping malls have mid range brands , the restaurants were ok . The best we enjoyed was the Sony museum . We had real fun . In the entrance they take a video of the visitors and compete for the top 10 best smiles . Inside are many other funny games .

Collection of malls, oedo onsen is highly recommended. The area is filled with shopping malls, but the fact that they are all connected through a second level deck was nice. It has a nice view. Decks has lots of souvenir shops and attractions, divercity has gundam statue, venus fort has toyota mega web, car history museum, but the others are just like any other malls. Oedo Onsen Monigatori is recommended after a long walk, nice dinner place while wearing a yukata.
Hi-tech worderful place. Come here to check it's attractions, it's a place full of life almost everyday. Nice to come with family and stay the whole day!

Man made island with shopping malls. Odaiba is a man made island that is full of shopping malls, entertainment and restaurants with amazing view of Tokyo. There's a replica of Statue of Liberty.Accessible by JR and a local train to one of Odaiba's stations.Prepare to spend a whole day here or more if you want to shop till you drop.

More shopping . As with most places we visited there is really nothing to do but shop. High price retail outlets. No signs telling you if different attractions. Send they just want ti draw you into the mall
Great day out. Good enough to spend a day there! (And loads of money :)) enough entertainment. Statue of Liberty and beach walk was amazing and museum of optical illusions is a great fun!
Large place. Very chilled piece of man filled ground.Diver city, palette town, Gundam, joypolis, onsen…Shopping, playing and eating all here

In the middel of nowhere, nothing to do,. Place for businesspeople, a few awful shopingcentres, close to disney. 1 hour traveling to most of the must sees in Tokio.impression; search chiara bakker japan in a flash.

If you have an extra day, Go here!. This was easy to get to and loads of fun for the kids and adults. Shopping and many great restaurants. Of the many stops. For younger kids a stop at the Water Museum is a must. Take the train to the closest station. But it still is a good walk there and then after walk over the bridge back. Its a nice usual walk. A visit to the SEGA game is great with a one time ticket purchase. Adults can go to the 2nd floor and eat the a great Pork Cutlet restaurant or ramen shops!

Great atmosphere. Love crossing the bridge to come to Odaiba as it so much more than a shopping area. The view of Tokyo is great from the numerous cafes and restaurants - it is just a great place to do shopping but also to enjoy an afternoon of eating and relaxing
Cool!. We loved the whole area! Too bad we did not have enough time to explore more though...we will be back next time!

Great place, lots of restaurants. We stayed at the Grand Pacific Le Daiba. It's conveniently located where the shopping and restaurants can be accessed via the walkway right outside the hotel. Facing the ocean, there's the Statue of Liberty and Rainbow Bridge. To the right of the hotel are Aqua City and Decks. If you stay on the walkway and head in the direction opposit the Statue of Liberty, you will see Diver City. It's one of the best places to shop and eat. If you keep walking straight and away from the Statue of Liberty, you will get to a park. Cross the street and keep walking straight and you will get to the Museum of Emerging Science and Innovations on the right. If you cross the next street and turn right, then go left about a block or so, you will get to Oedo Onsen. I highly recommend this place. There's a $24.80 entrance fee. You will need to remove your footwear and place it in a locker, then choose a yukata. Go to the dressing room and wear the yukata. Your clothes will be left in another locker. Get a massage. It's so good. You'll have to pay for that. Go to the foot bath and get the fish to eat the dead skin off your feet. Pay for that experience, too. Then shop at their food court and have lunch or browse through their store and buy some wonderful Japanese goods.
Loved It Here - But It Rained!. Plan about a day to explore Odaiba. This is where giant Gundam and rainbow bridge are. There is also lots of shopping.
A MUST TO VIST. Odaiba is a man made island off Tokyo,plenty to do and see,great views,shops,places to eat,etc,needs a full day at least for your vist.
Lovely island!. We visited here on the guided bus tour. It's a great ride on the bus and the boat rides looked good to. There seems to be a lot to do here. Lovely views across the bridge.

Nella media di tokyo. I went to Odaiba to see the gundam reproduction. You arrive there with a railway that offer a beautifull view of the place, there are some shops, a gundam café, a nice walk and a nice view. We waited the evening to see the light effects of copy of statue of liberty and the bridge.

Surprisingly good. I went to Odaiba because I wanted to see Tokyo from the bay area. Well I definitely got that and so much more. I went up the Fiji TV building into sphere and got a great view of the bay. It was so peaceful and quiet I got to sit down and enjoy the view for a change. It costs 550 yen to the lookout.Three really big shopping malls (Aqua, Diver and Venus Fort) I quite liked Aqua City seemed more in my price range. Got a decent bowl of tokatsu ramen from the food court on 5F.I went on the ferris wheel at a snap decision. It was pretty good offering good views but a bit pricey at 920 yen. I was surprised how I liked Odaiba. It seems so open and spacious and relaxing. The park grounds have been done really well.
Great for half a day out. Hunted down the majestic Gundam & took in the night scenery which was very romantic. Had dinner in Dog Dept Cafe surrounded by furry customers. Was so fun ;)

Man made Island made makes for a great shopping experiences!. I came to Odaiba with no expectations at all but was very impressed with the island, there was a lot to see and do (shopping at aqua city, decks, diver city and Venus fort). It is easily accessible by train with a short transfer from Shiodome station. If shopping is not your thing, still a great visit for the photo opportunities of the skyline.

Good option for a rainy day. The best part about Odaiba is getting there with the Yurikamome line, a monorail that moves swiftly across the skyscrapers: excellent if you have kids traveling with you.
Odaiba itself is a big shopping mall, with some good entertainment, such as Legoland, Joypolis etx.

Huge area and lots of things to see. Whenever I return to Tokyo, I will be sure to visit Odaiba. Because of the onsen place (Oedo Onsen Monogatari) that's available beside Telecom Centre station and the huge shopping malls that's around the place. Tokyo Diver City is a huge shopping mall with many different kind of shops plus that 1:1 scale Gundam is just right outside the mall. I went in early October this year and there's a Odaiba Oktoberfest that's right beside Tokyo Diver City and it's AMAZING. There are performances by the Germans and many different kind of German beers that's available. Entrance fee is free so you're have to just pay for the beer. Recommended to visit Odaiba when you're in Tokyo as it's a great place to do some shopping and sight seeing. Not to mention the amazing onsen place too!

Great Sunday day out!. Odaiba has plenty to see and do including a Statue of Liberty, Madame Tussaud's. A big wheel and plenty of restaurants and shops.Worth a slow stroll and very easy to get to on the train from the city

If you miss Odaiba , you miss a great part of Tokyo!. If you find yourself with nothing to do on a weekend,go to Odaiba city built on reposed land right on water.You will enjoy the spectacular ocean views, great restaurants and see a different part of Tokyo!We loved the long shopping area and visiting the Fuji building!

Overall is good. I went there on early of spring so it still foggy and rainy. But there some things can be done here like madame tussauds museum and also take a photo with the replica of liberty statue. In the night, there is festival that worth to see and rainbow bridge. Recommended activity: taking the one way cruise and sit on the deck ;)

Nice place to kill a few hours in Tokyo. Nice place for shopping and watching the sun go down along the beach front. Check out the Gundam robot outside the Diver City plaza, they were showing a manga film projected onto the wall of the plaza while we were there in the evening. For photographers with tripods, get to the ferris wheel before 10pm as that's when they turn the lights out.

Beautiful View of Tokyo. Odaiba is an island across Tokyo Bay allowing it amazing views of Tokyo across Tokyo Bay. Both day and night the view is spectacular. Along with great shopping/entertaining/dining complexes Odaiba is also a destination for festivals in the parks surrounding it. It's a must stop place if visiting Tokyo, Japan. Just the train ride across the Rainbow Bridge is worth the time if time is short!

gigantic Gundam (immobile until 2019). The new line of train to get to Odaiba offers a great view all along the way especially at night!Odaiba has many attractions, one including the gigantic Gundam standing in the front entrance of Diver City Town (which is a huge shopping mall among many around)! It's quiet impressive and again, especially at night with all the lights lid up. It's worth a trip just to get out of the hustle and bustle and get another feel of what Tokyo has to offer!

An island in Tokyo. It was a good experience to even reach there using the subway.. Anyway, we went to see the Gundam robot which is pretty awesome.. Got Gundam cafe that sell the anime merch nearby.. Its free !!! Anyway, dont forget to go to see the Lady Liberty statue as well.. It is just a walk away and dont forget to take the picture from nice angle

A whole day visit isn't enough. It's an awesome place. Like NobuCT said, it's indeed 'Something for everyone'. Do plan your itinerary well else you'll have a lot of walking to do. The Science Museum (Miraikan) has a small deep-sea submarine in which you can go in. I saw many cosplayers at Odaiba when I was there in Mid-June. There're arcade & shopping centres too. For those who like One Piece, there's a One Piece restaurant at Level 7 of Fuji TV. The place is popular amongst families and couples. Make sure you take a photo of the Gundam Statue.

Great place to spend whole day having fun. This is such a trendy Japanese area. There are so many interesting shops, museums and restaurants. To go around Odaiba, I highly recommend to use Yurikamome monorail. Just get 1 day pass, and have a look around there! The view is awesome too.

Excellent day trip. Others have spoken of location and access. I would add that this makes for an almost full day of adventure in Tokyo. Eat lunch on the "Decks" boardwalk overlooking Tokyo Bay. Walk along the beach. Time travel to 190's Japan by visiting Daiba Icchome Shotengai, located on the 4th floor of Decks shopping mall. Relax and watch the ceiling change from dusk to dawn every 30 minutes at Venus Fort shopping mall. Be back at Decks around sunset for great views of the city and Rainbow Bridge.

Something for everyone. Lots of different things to do and see here. Able to satisfy the range of ages: food, games, museums, view, shopping. Easy access by train from the city and if it's hot you can stay indoors and be entertained.

Shopping and Gundam Statue. With such special buildings in the area like Fuji TV Building, Telecom Center and Tokyo Big Sight there are two things that overshadow the amazing architecture. The first being a life sized Gudam Statue and the other is the plethora of shopping malls.Venus Fort, Diver City and Decks Tokyo Beach. Plan to spend time shopping at all of the above as they are all within walking distance of each other.

Lovely place to visit in Tokyo. Gets you out of the 'crammed in' feeling you get in Tokyo sometimes. Also nice to be by the water. Could spend a whole day here, but we only have a couple of hours in the evening. Nice atmosphere and lots to see and do!

Nice Place to visit in Tokyo. Odaiba is great place to see in Tokyo and requires a full day. You can see replica of statue of liberty, Fuji TV buliding, Madame Tussauds, Legoland are in same area. Shopping malls, Toyrus are there. Overall very nice place. Always use monorail to visit odaiba to enjoy the maximum.

Ideal for shopping but not much else...... Lots of options for shopaholics in Odaiba but I didn't find much more of note. The replica of the Statue of Liberty is housed here and there's also the giant gundam model that is worth getting a photo with but (unless I wanted to go shopping) I wouldn't see a need to return again on a future visit to Tokyo.

Odaiba is a very nice place to spend the day.. Odaiba is a great place to visit. It's a little Island about 15min from Shiodome and Shimbashi by train. There are several Malls and Outlet Stores to choose from when shopping. Restaurants and Fast Food Shops for eating. Lego Land and Madame Tussauds Wax Museum are located in Odaiba.

The Other side of the Rainbow. On the other side of the "rainbow" bridge, you will discover the artificial island of Odaiba. Originally built to protect Tokyo from a sea invasion, today the "man made" fort island has become a popular shopping and entertainment district. Odaiba is broken down into its own smaller districts of shopping, fun, entertainment.The Fuji TV Building is headquarters for Japans private TV stations. The building is one of the most clever futuristic architectural creations and certainly worth a look. The observation deck provides great views too. Decks, a shopping mall featuring various stores, includes Joypolis, Legoland,and multiple indoor themed centres. Aquacity is another shopping mall featuring various stores, restaurants, cafes and a 13 screen cinema complex. The fifth floor provides the best views of Rainbow Bridge, especially at night whilst enjoying the Ramen food. DiverCity Tokyo Plaza is a representation of Japans anime, and again is an entertainment district within itself  Telecom Center Observation Deck actually provides views of Mount Fuji on clear days and again is a great place to capture the illumination of the bridge at night. Museum of Maritime Science is housed in a cruise ship that sits alongside the waterfront of Odaiba.National Museum of Emerging Science also known as Miraikan is an interactive bilingual science museum that exhibits environmental issues, robots, biology & space exploration.Palette Town for me was the real hub of Odaiba with the beauty of the Venus Fort shopping mall that words cannot describe, Toyota Mega Web will allow you to experience the sheer pleasure of the latest model cars and technology. There are some exciting attractions/rides here for yourself and the kids to enjoy.Leisureland and the Ferris wheel are also worth taking in. Odaiba provides a whole day of entertainment and is a great escape from the Tokyo City Shock.

Time-filler. Odaiba is nice if you need something to beef up your itinerary a little. I recommend boarding the water bus from Asakusa to get here, and then either walking or taking the train back over Rainbow Bridge. Once in Odaiba however, everything must be accessed by foot and some things are quite spaced apart. Good for shopping, eating, and Gundam fans.

I must return to Odaiba!. We visited DiverCity Tokyo to see the 4-story tall Gundam robot. It was very cool! We only had time to do a little shopping and to have a quick dinner at the food court in DiverCity, so we did not get to see the great majority of what Odaiba has to offer. For this reason, my 4 out of 5 star rating is mainly geared to DiverCity, and I must return to see more of Odaiba and its many attractions!
Nice View. easy way to going to Odaiba using JR Yamanote Line till Shimbashi station then walk about 5 minutes and take Private line Yurikamome Line. take train to Odaiba - Kaihinkoen station :)

Fun Visit. We could have spent a whole day there! There was so much to see and interesting. We planned our time there for the afternoon and evening so we could have the gorgeous night views of Tokyo Bay. Spent much time at Mega Web (Toyota Showroom) which was fascinating getting into all those cars. Make sure you go in the Mega Theater (free) for a fun ride. We did not do any shopping but walked through the malls. Had the best ramen at Yo! Tekko Ya, Ground floor of Decks. Took lots of pictures of the night views. Our hotel was just across the bay, so it was very convenient. Will definitely come back, at least for the ramen.

Worth half a day. Hundreds of shops, restaurants, and photo opportunities. Worth half a day of your time in Tokyo - if only for the ride on the driverless trains that take you there from the city side of the bay (try to get in the front car). DiverCity and AquaCity are two big shopping centres. DiverCity is newer and bigger and has loads of restaurants on the top floors and a food court on the ground floor. A giant Gundam robot currently stands close to one of the doors - worth a photo. Other event places here.

I love Odaiba!!!. It was raining when we visited this place but it didn't stop us from exploring the area. We visited Madame Tussauds wax museum first and spent the rest of our day in DiverCity (shopping, ahem ahem) . Before we decided to call it a day, we snapped a few pictures of Gundam and Tokyo's version of NY's statue of liberty.
A must visit. a must destination for a tourist , an island which has Malls,very nice view ,especially at night ,of the city and a wheel on which you can see the city from high

Shops, beach and restaurants. I enjoyed my trip here. There are some amazing buildings to look at, a nice mall, a beach to be lazy on, loads of restaurants and things to do. You can easily spend the day here and have lots of fun.

Beautiful. I went to Odaiba out of curiosity. I just love the view (and being able to make my friends jealous of the Gundam statue). Other than that, there's nothing much to see. Fresh air though. And the smell of the sea. Went there for 1/2 day only
