Same old same old. There is nothing to see and/or do here that is in any way more Japanese than American. If you miss New Jersey style outlet shopping Odaiba is for you. Food is ehhh, prices are mall-like with nothing original to buy. This only good things are the view (may be an hour of gazing out to the water or take the ferris wheel), the bridge (you can walk that), and the fact that you can see Fuji on a clear day. You could also take a ferry... which is kinda cool. Totally skippable, unless you have nothing to do and need a break from the amazingness that is the rest of Tokyo.
Date night . Great food, shopping and view!! I love odaiba and it's just beautiful out there! Must visit there if you are on honeymoon:)

Island life Tokyo style. Odaiba is a nice little getaway from the crowded tourist attractions downtown Tokyo.But for me it wasn't that interesting.There is a boardwalk with some shops, and a little beach where a lot of japanse people come to relax.Also a big mall but did not go there because it was great weather and did not want to waste a good day by shopping inside.Nice view on Tokyo and the rainbow bridge, but only come here when you have some time left, and you have checked the boxes of all other interesting attractions on you're must see list.

Toyoto showroom and science museum . The Toyota showroom was great, if you love cars you will find this exhibition very interesting. There were about 100 cars in the showroom. The science and innovation museum was also great and worth a visit.. The robots were so amazing!!

Great place to stay.. There is so much to see and do, the Toyota museum at Palette town is great and you must go see the many shops devoted to pets at Palette town. You can easily get from shopping centre to shopping centre by walking. The Fuji television station had lots happening when we stayed there giving a good fun vibe to the place.

Popular Waterfront!. Odaiba is a large artificial island in Tokyo Bay. From the Tokyo station it will take approx. 30 min by metro to go there. Odaiba is a now new high-tech shopping, restaurant, residential and entertainment area in south-west Tokyo.Many thing to do or to visit there. For example, the Fuji TV Headquarters with facilites opened to public such as globe-shaped observatory, mall and restaurants. The Palette Town with a Toyota car technology showcase that will fascinate car nuts and a big wheels, shops and restaurant.Nice place to go outside the center.
Area worth visiting. A very nice and peaceful area. We went here at night and sat down near the river and found it very enjoyable. Also there is a very big mall near the station.

Lovely seaside resort with plenty to see and do. If your staying in Tokyo then its worth travelling here for a day trip. We were staying at the Hotel Metropolitan in Ikebukuro which is only a short tube ride to Odaiba. This resort has a large shopping mall, the Fuji TV building, and also the Toyota car factory where you get to drive the cars around a track! My hubby loved looking at their car exhibition too. We then too a leisurely stroll to the waterfront/seaside area. The views were lovely and it was a great spot for taking plenty of pictures. As there is a bridge with a miniature statue of liberty replica, a bridge and hover boats, beside other things of interest.

Great place - nice getaway from Tokyo center. I was positively surprised by this place. The metro ride alone was fun - although more expensive than normal metro fares (320yen from Shimbashi). And it's probably more fun at night so you can enjoy the lighting of the Rainbow Bridge. Odaiba was a quiet place, but still full of things to do. We enjoyed the shopping mall and the Gundam Statue, as well as the Statue of Liberty. It was also more windy there than in Tokyo central, which was nice and refreshing after a day of heat. Try to avoid getting back from Odaiba to Shimbashi between 6pm and 7pm, due to rush hour.
One of my favs !. Had the best day in Odaiba, even though it was raining. Stay until the night, trust me ; no words can describe the view you get from there with rainbow bridge right in front
Relaxing day out. Nice for a day out with or without the family. Heaps of shops, places to eat. Megaweb definitely worth a visit for any car enthusiastic s.
Paradise. You can shop, eat and enjoy museums without leaving Odaiba. You can even try hot spring on the island. Great location and easy access to the central Tokyo.

Worth Considering as a base for Tokyo trip. Not necessarily worth a trip if your are staying in the City, but Odaiba is a great alternative base - good hotels, great shopping, plenty of dining and wide open spaces to enjoy.

Why you must visit this place! Preferably with a boyfriend 😂. Where do I start. Odaiba was such a pleasant place to visit. I went there with a friend, and to my surprise, there were loads couples there. I slowly regretted not going there with a brad Pitt lookalike. Anyways, you must visit this place just to see the sunset. The view is breathtaking, make sure to get one of the bench seats, relax and watch the sun set. Somehow, odaiba wasn't that crowded compared to inner tokyo, which made it even more of a pleasant experience. Taking the self driving train to Odaiba added that extra bit of awesomeness to it, only because we took the front seat facing the railway ahead. This way, we managed to get an amazing view whilst on our way to Odaiba. One more thing, there's plenty of entertainment going on there, as well as plenty of restaurants and shopping areas. However, I mainly went there for the sunset view, which really was one of the best things I did in Japan.

A lot more than just the Gundam, plan and research for a good few days here!. This place is full of some of the most amazing things you will see in Japan and I would urge you to spend 2 or more days here, from the Miraiken to the ferris wheel and the museum of trick art and aquarium, it is easy to spend a lot of really enjoyable time here and of course there is the Gundam!

THE place for shopping. this is the place to go for shopping in Tokyo. go to Venus Fort and to Divers' City mall and you ll find everything you are looking for to buy along with great options to have lunch and dinner.also visit the Fuji TV building which has a unique architecture

2 days to explore odaiba. awesome place to spend a whole day around. aqua city, madam tussauds museum, lego land n so many things. u can walk 10mins for mega web a toyota car park n gaint wheel its awesome. over all u need atleast 2 days to explore odaiba.

Fun for short trip. A good place for a quick tour about 3-4 four hours. I recommend to drop by palette town, check ferris wheel, then head to Gundam front at diver city, then go to the observation deck in front of aqua city for rainbow bridge. And visit it at night, preferably come at 6, if too early wander around palette town and venus fort for a while.

So much to see and do. We went yesterday and were a bit slow getting ready in the morning and didn't arrive until 11:30am. You could easily spend days here. So get there as early as possible. Endless amounts of shops and restaurants. Fun attractions for the whole family too. We did Legoland and Madam Tussaud's, the big wheel, and saw the Gundam robot show. We ran out of time for Joyopololis, the museums and Sony building. We took the monorail over rainbow bridge which was great for photos of Odaiba and then the Tokyo train back. Gotta see this place if you travel to Tokyo area.
Odaiba. One of the best places to see and shop around Tokyo, there's shops and food places to eat. If you want to see the sunset this is a good place to be!

Great place for kids. If you are travelling with kids and have already visited the main sights in Tokyo and the surroundings, this is a good place to include in your "to-do" list. We spent half a day there and we could have easily spent an entire day, as there is so much to do and see. We visited Trick Art Museum at Decks, Gundam at Diver City and the Ferris Wheel at Pallette Town.Note that the Museum of Emerging Science is closed on Tuesdays.If you only have a limited time in Tokyo, skip Odaiba and visit other places.

Short but sweet.. Odaiba island is man made and is one of Tokyo's entertainment district. Not the only way but the best way to get there (IMHO) is on Tokyo's water bus that you can catch in Asakusa. Short and sweet? We could've spent the whole day here and probably won't even cover all the attractions this place had to offer. Anyways I came all this way just to see the Statue of Liberty, whew! Our plan was to go up the sphere in the Fuji TV bldg and ride a ferries wheel, this would have been a great place to see Tokyo from a different view point or vantage. Even if our plan didn't work out just walking around and sightseeing was worth the trip. This is a great place to bring your kids, just google Odaiba and find Palette Town, Diver City and Legoland just to name a few. It even has a beach and a replica of the Statue of Liberty! Have fun!
Perfect place for a quiet evening. Artificial beach with the view of rainbow bridge is just awesome.a quiet place to sit down and relax.Beautiful view in the night with lights all around.

There is a lot of human endeavor to see, Malls, bridge, buildings, and lots of people. Fireworks is Awesome. Taking the Yurikamome monorail around Odaiba back and forth is worthwhile just to see how far it stretches and what it looks like. There is very interesting building Architecture to look it on Odaiba. After an initial look around then you need to decide what you want to see more of. If you want to see big malls jam backed with people, Aqua City or Diver City are a couple of likely places. Good food can be found in either place. If it is views you want then the Odaiba park is worth visiting. The Rainbow bridge is quite impressive. We visited on Aug 8 when there was fireworks shot off over the bay. 12000 fireworks in 80minutes, It was the most impressive fireworks display for volume and quality I have ever seen. If there is a fireworks display there again I would urge folks to go and view it.

New York of the east. The first thing that will strike you about this place is the calm. Visually stunning, a lot of people will mistake it for New York in the back drop. Great place to spend a quiet evening enjoying brilliant views of the river, city skyline, tokyo tower etc.

Man made beach. Lovely beach in Tokyo with view of Rainbow bridge. Take the boat cruise going to asakusa and enjoy the view of tokyo! you will pass by tokyo tower, sky tree and beer building too. Its lovely!

Surprising Odaiba. Self contained Odaiba offers almost everything a visitor could ask for. From free bus rides to good food, Odaiba offers good fun to anyone who is looking to get away or to shop till you drop as they have a shopping outlet Venus Fort there.Good shopping at Divers City, Aqua Centre and other shopping malls. They even have Hello Kitty Japan shop if you are a hello kitty fan ! Not to mention Daiso right next to your hotel.

Odaiba - a must visit. Would recommend anyone with kids going to Tokyo must visit Odiba. Very easy to get to by train. Lots of things to see and do. A huge shopping mall and of course the Gandom Robot. Lots of activities for the kids and a beautiful scenery to see on the way.

Worth a visit but only if you have seen the other main sites of Tokyo. Good half a day trip but the place lacks culture and is very quiet. I would spend my time elsewhere if you only have a small amount of time in Tokyo

Nice target for a river boat trip and good shopping.. We took a boat trip to Obaida from Asakusa. The river trip was nice and although the boat had no AC on to top deck the breeze was cool ( we where there on a very hot day, 35C). Odaiba itself, with the shops, where not bad at all. The multistore complex offeres many restaurants and shops, all different and both with international brands and those not know to Europeans. We took a ride with the ferris wheel, and had a great view of the harbour area and the southern skyline of Tokyo.The trip is worthwile both for the river bota ride and the shopping. Odaiba has a small beach but the water did not appear clean for swimming.
Man made Island. Odaiba is the artificial Island made by Japanese and it is district of Tokyo ,where you will find lots of commercial and fun ,eating activities

Futuristic and fun!. We spent about half a day in Odaiba-it almost felt like another planet! There were cool looking buildings, a pretty multi-coloured bridge, the giant Gundam robot. I remember seeing a beautiful sunset as well. Also the top floor of the mall had a number of different varieties of ramen from various parts of Japan-delicious!

Great for fans of Gundam and Toyota. Gundam fans would love Diver City while Toyota fans would love Palette Town.
Odaiba is quite big and would take about a day if you want to spend time on the 4 big malls.
Gundams fans, please take note that they have a so called museum for you to visit at Diver City (1200 yen as of 13th Aug 15).

Tokyo Ghost Tllrain to Odaiba island . Odaiba is an artificial island in Tokyo Bay.
You can reach by automated train without driver.
Sit on the 1st row near the window.
You will enter the landscape.
You will be in a cage during 5 mn ! Crossing the Rainbow Bridge 756 m long and . . 100 m above the ocean.
Fantastic experience

The big Ferris wheel in Odaiba Amusement Area. The big Ferris wheel which can also be called a symbol in Daiba. It takes pride in its outstanding view which can get a bird's-eye view of two towers, that are Tokyo Tower, Tokyo sky tree(tower), as well as 2 birdges Tokyo gate bridge, Rainbow Bridge and Tokyo famous place . The night view of the bey area colored beautifully is also romantic, and big Ferris wheel illuminations are recommended.Big Ferris wheel is in an area in Palette Town, so there are many restaurants and shops in Palette Twon.You can also do the shopping.

Great beach, entertainment and shopping. We spent a great afternoon strolling around Odaiba, watching people and entertainment. There are several shopping centres along the beachfront and there is an excellent view of the Rainbow Bridge. We especially enjoyed the Toyota Experience centre and watching the sun go down.

Nice half/full day activity.. We got to Odaiba via a water taxi from Hama Rikyu park. This was nice because we got to see the city from the water and go under the bridge on the way. There is a beach and walkway along the water. The mini Statue of Liberty is there but this isn't anything special. There are some large department stores with food areas so plenty of options for shopping and to eat. We found some shops there that we didn't see anywhere else.On the way back we took the monorail. This again had plenty to look at on the way.Odaiba is nice to visit and look around if you have more than a couple of days. The travelling to and from was the most memorable part.

Incredible and modern reclamation island. Visited this artificial reclamation island in Tokyo that is a huge complex of shopping malls, office towers and entertainment district. Main attraction is the huge Gundam Statue in front of the DiverCity Plaza, the Liberty statue and the unique TV office towers. Visit the Venus Fort for a Venice-like interiors and a car museum with displays of old to modern cars to concept cars (there's a model of DeLorean car from the infamous "Back To The Future" movie)

A different Tokyo!. Modern buildings on a man made island in Tokyo Bay. There are plenty of shopping opportunities, a small car museum and a Toyota showroom with the latest offerings from this car manufacturer as well as some future models. Something for everyone. Provides a stark contrast to other parts of Tokyo where streets are narrower and buildings located cheek by jowl.
Fun. Lots of things to do here and lots of fun to be had. I think there are wonderful views and it is a fun and dynamic place . Worth going !
Must see for traveler's!!!. My favorite place on my trip! Great malls and food! Ride the ferris wheel to get a view of the area. Not overcrowded and very calm place.

quick stop to convention. The best thing about Odaiba is getting there. The monorail is a fun public transportation especially if you can get a front car seat. Odaiba is a popular place for kids as there are play grounds, rides and parks. The restaurants in the area are quite ok especially if you are going to the convention as they are a few train stops away and provide better choices than in the convention halls.

People love the pics we took here. A great place to stop for a while, and snap a picture of the faux statue of liberty & the "life-size" GUNDAM. It is more a big mall complex than anything else, but there are fun shops & the cafeteria actually has good food. They light the GUNDAM up at night, and there is also a little GUNDAM café. It is easy to wander here for a few hours. The pictures we took in this area are some of people's favorites from what we took Tokyo.

Nice place. Went to see the Gundam and ended up in an Idol festival taking place. Ate dinner at a restaurant with a view of the rainbow bridge. The place looked very nice and I would definitely go there again.

Lots to see & do. The Odaiba area is on a man made island in Tokyo Harbor and has become quite a lively area. There is a wonderful science museum (highlights were the robots and the planetarium dome theater), giant Ferris wheel, Toyota "experience" (with old cars, new cars, driving simulators, and a motion ride, all of which are free), and other museums and attractions.

Summer Fun to be had. Odaiba offers Summer for all ages! there is a Ferris Wheel, Mall, Kid Park and festivals all summer long. Best of all, you can take the train straight there on the Saiko line from the Shinjuku station.There really is something for everyone!

Odaiba... a new island. This is a man made island in Tokyo bay. It's very modern and it has so much to do that you will find 1 day is not enough to do it all. Lots of shopping centres. Lots of museums. Lots of amusement parks. if you have children and you need to give them some fun activities, Odaiba is the place. I just wish we had more time to explore some more...

Watch the Japanese youth enjoy the weekend "out of town" (almost). Lots of restaurants and shops in the two big department stores reached by the monorail (giving great views of the Tokyo bay and even, if you are lucky, Mount Fuji) from Shimbashi station to Daiba. Also the onsen (two stops more) which is pictoresque with a "disney like" oedo village, where everybody, including yourself wears yukatta. Great for selfies "I am in Japan"
GUNDAM. this is only place in the world probably to see a life size 1:1 scale of a gundam. to all GUNDAM fans, this is a must come place!

Must see place when you visit Tokyo. The Tokyo skyline view with the rainbow bridge was amazing. Happened to see this during the day but if I visit again will definitely go there to see the night time view.

Great place for tourist.. A great area to visit, kids friendly and lots of food and shopping for tourist. Make sure to chose a nice day to take good photos. Be prepare to walk a lot and spend couple good hours on both side of the street.

Great spot to see the sunset..... Odaiba, exactly the Daiba station, the plaza near the statue of Liberty is a great spot to watch Tokyo sunset....I have never seen a great sunset like in Daiba where you get Rainbow bridge, the skyscrapers, statue of Liberty becoming great silhouette with the sunset. Enjoyed this place very much...great for photo shooters !

Best place during my Tokyo visit. Its a place worth visiting if you are in Tokyo even though the Yurikamome line is rather expensive. If you are travelling around the island and planning to stop more then 2 stations, it is best to get an unlimited pass. For me i just stop at Daiba stop. From there, you can access to the Rainbow bridge, Aqua City (where the large gundam is), Fuji TV station and etc. The best time to go is around 7-730pm when the sun is setting. I didnt spend a long time there but if u r going, would suggest to spend a little more time to explore the place.

Nice park complex area. We went there by subway Rinkai-fukutoshin to Tokyo Teleport station. Walking to Pallete town Toyota mega web. Children enjoyed being there, and we spent almost 4 hours in Mega-web because kids loved cars. After that we walked to Diversity plaza, Aqua City, and Decks. We took some photos with Liberty statue near hotel Nikko. We enjoyed sitting on the beach and watching beautiful rainbow bridge. We disappointed because didn't have so many times. Next time will visit there again, absolutely! Love Odaiba so much...

Nice Place. We dropped by Odaiba at the end of our day tour with Hato Bus. It's a nice area with a good view if you have time on your hands...but coming from America, this place is not a must-do. I wouldn't specifically plan time for it. There's plenty to see in the main Tokyo area and Ginza is a good place for glitzy shopping.

Great place for families. This was our first visit to Odaiba, but it was a great day trip for a family with young children. Great shopping and kids entertainment including Gundam, Lego. Mostly indoor activities.

A fun day out for all!. We went here on a day scheduled for rain, and we found it was a good choice. There are several indoor shopping malls, with many choices of restaurants. There is also a large arcade style building which was great for killing a couple of hours. Many of the games are in japanese however so that could present difficulties. There were some lovely views of Rainbow Bridge, and the Ferris wheel was beautiful lit up at night. I would advise dedicating a whole day to visiting Odaiba, as I feel we missed parts of it in our rush to get round.
A must-visit part of Tokyo.. An awesome area with plenty of shopping, arcades and views. The giant ferris-wheel is a must-visit- location when in Tokyo.
Great view of Tokyo. A beautiful oase in the heart of Tokyo. Beaches, great shopping and a amazing view of Tokyo. It is a must to visit when in Tokyo.

Odaiba: a wonderful place for shopping, entertainments, museums, Onsen, or just relaxing !!. I love Odaiba very much which has a lot of shops, entertainments, restaurants to have fun. These include Mini Statue of Liberty, futuristic Fuji TV Headquarter and two good hotels in front of Odaiba station, Sony ExploraScience in Aqua City Odaiba, Tokyo Joypolis amusement park in Decks Tokyo Beach, Gundam statue in front of Diver City, Venus Fort and Pallete Town Ferris Wheel, National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation, and Oedo Onsen Monogatari Hot Spring. At night, you can have dinner at restaurants in Aqua City Odaiba or Decks Tokyo Beach Buildings, enjoying a breathtaking view of Tokyo Bay and Rainbow Bridge. Alternatively, you can have dinner in a Yakatabune Ship.See this wonderful video, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gk3WFKBG6jg

Great view over Tokyo Bay. I have visited Odaiba twice. It takes around 1 hour to get to from the centre of Tokyo (Shinjuku) though worth the trip.Heaps of large shopping malls, a mini statue of liberty, a huge Transformer robot and lots of cool restaurants, cafes and dessert shops.

Beautiful views. Someone goes here for discount shopping , someone for food in the shopping stores. I go here for views. Beautiful views over bay and the rainbow bridge. Nice place for photographers.Need to take tripod wide you. Certainly are the views at night most exciting.Very recommended.

odaiba should do better,. Typical Japan, clean and orderly, but the attractions in this part of Tokyo suck! They have got a wonderful beach front area, but just like at the parks you cannot have fun. Too restrictive in every aspect. The dogs have more leniency than do the persons walking along with them. There is a place called Venus Fort, modelled after one of the shopping centres in Los Vegas, that is so boring. The design is confusing and parking expensive. The food court is set up in such a way as to have you visit one time only, so there is not much effort put into making the dishes really taste good. Again, expensive. There are actually two places where you might have some fun, but after you have ridden one ferris wheel, you've ridden them all. Below the ferris wheel is a Toyota showroom that has go cart type cars for the kiddies to drive. The problem is, if you are foreign, you will probably not get to drive the cart/cars unless you should speak Japanese fluently, be at least 4' tall and have a fake driver's license. This is only issued during the week when you are probably enjoying the sites somewhere else. NOT WORTH THE HASSLE. I highly do not recommend this place. It is a waste of time and resources, You will be very disappointed

Malls Offers great variety of restaurants for great meals. Great view of the rainbow bridge, and A perfect place for a short weekend with my children. For expats like us who are longing for western meals and shopping, this area is a must see. Children aged 13 and 15 had fun with the different arcades. Spent half a day here, but children requested to go back for shopping and great meal.

Tech and shopping. It's a great idea of combining tech development with down-to-earth pastime like general shopping - some shops offered tax free shopping. It's very pretty huge plot of land, so you'll need to allocate a good half day in order not to feel rush. We had a peek at the Toyota showroom, where you can test drive cars. The attraction for us was to take the train back to the 'mainland' via the Rainbow bridge. If you've had enough of 'organic' Tokyo, then Odaiba could be interesting. But if you have few days, then I'd would skip it.

The Future Side of Tokyo. One of my favorite places during my trip in Tokyo is when I visited Odaiba. This small part of Tokyo gives you such an enormous futuristic point of view of the city. All I can say is that you will find something different from any other areas around Tokyo. You'll get more fun by visiting Madame Tussauds, Legoland, Aqua City, and don't forget to stay there after the sunset because Odaiba is much more beautiful at night.

Lots of Fun!. Odaiba has all the shops, entertainment, restaurants and sights you need for a fun time! Between Diver City and the Gundam, Joyopolis, Lego World, and the fake Statue of Liberty, there is a lot of fun things to do here that can keep you busy all day. You can get a breathtaking view of Tokyo and the Rainbow Bridge at night, and the ferris wheel is worth a spin if you want to take a date.

One of my favourite areas in Tokyo. I can't explain it, there is just something special about Odaiba. It is one of my favourite spots in Tokyo, with museums, malls, beaches, monorail, eateries, onsen, you name it!
Joypolis. If considering Joypolis for small to tween kids, go to Disney instead of Joypolis. Japanese clientele mostly high school and college groups and couples.
Well equipped. Sightseeing, shopping, games, 3D trick eye museum, maritime museum, Gundam figure, outdoor and indoor dining, onsen, everything is available here in this district :)

Must visit...in Tokyo. The first and foremost reason we went to Odaiba is to visit the Miraikan and meet Asimo the Robot. After that we went to see Gundam...it was huge and great for photos. Then we visited Aqua City...and did some shopping. Aqua City was a nice and surprisingly affordable place to shops. The view of the harbour and the Rainbow Bridge at night from Aqua City was amazing..it was such a beautiful sight...Odaiba is a great place to visit...lots of attraction for every ages...and one day i think was not enough if you want to visit all attractions...But the view of the Rainbow Bridge at night was superb...even if you came for this it is worth it...

great base for a stay in Tokyo. Excellent base for a stay in Tokyo, monorail is really fast and often and not crowded, lots of shops and places to eat and fabulous views. We stayed at the Grand Pacific Le Daiba, just twenty steps to the Daiba Station, which after a day walking Tokyo was a godsend

Nice bayview, always FUN. Second visit, just a short distance away Fuji TV. Totally in love with the view and air, always refreshing/relaxing be it at deck or outdoor roof which i love the most. You can feel the zen at its outdoor roof, there's a small shrine for prayers and Fuji TV as its backdrop.Ramen and Divers City was the initial reason why we first visited Odaiba. You can purchase Odaiba one day pass to venture out other places!

Great day. Went here on our last day in Tokyo and wished we had spent more time to be honest (we had a plane to catch!)Some interesting sights/photo opportunities such as the Statue of Liberty replica and huge Gundam/Namco robot statue outside one of the malls. We went into a couple of the malls and took the kids to LegoLand and Maddam Tussauds there (you can get a small discount on a joint ticket) and eat in one of the malls at a lovely and very authentic all you can eat Indian restaurant. We would have like to have gone to the Sega Joypolis but time didn't allow. Definitely will do next time. I would recommend this place if you fancy doing some shopping and a more western side to Japan.
Modern Tokyo bay. There is a very great walk if you start from the rainbow bridge to Odaiba, quite interesting tour on the bay and fantastic views of the city.

Nice place. Lots to do. . We spent most of our day in the wax museum and trick art area. Had a ton of fun. Lots of shopping and tourist areas. Gundam statue was definitely a highlight for me. Grew up watching the cartoon as a kid. All of these attractions are located within walking distance of each other (Divers City and DECKS) making it quite convenient.

Second visit and I still like this place. When you want to avoid the crowd from the city center, Odaiba is a good place for you to relax to shop and eat in a more spacious area, also you can enjoy refreshing air from the gardens and outdoor places.

Always Fun. Always a great place to visit with so many options. This time around we visited the Museum for Emerging Sciences and Venus Fort with the car museum. Great fun and many options for food, entertainment, and shopping.

Much more than shopping. I visited Odaiba on a rainy July day with my 13 year old daughter and her friend. It was the perfect place for girls this age. It is very easy to travel to - we took the subway to Shiodome station and then followed the signs to the Yurikamome monorail. There are lovely views of the bay on the trip across. We arrived at Odaibakaihinkoen station at about 11am and had an early lunch at Bills which was delicious. We then wandered through the shopping mall which has all sorts of interesting shops and then found our way to Madame Tussauds. The girls loved this - we had great fun here, it wasn't crowded at all on a Friday and we took many photos - highly recommended. After the excitement here we had an ice-cream and then stumbled upon a photo booth area which does computer generated makeup enhancement. It was all in Japanese but the girls worked it out and did a few sessions posing for photos, it was only 400y per session and great fun again. This place was somewhere downstairs from Madame Tussauds. We then walked along the deck outside to the 'statue of liberty' and took more photos of the lovely view of the bay. There are many shopping malls here with a variety of shops. We took a VERY crowded monorail back at about 5.30pm. Such a fun day out! And we didn't even get to the Miraikan science museum, Sony science centre, the onsen or the Toyota mega web.....Highly recommended for all ages!

Glossy, fluffy, shopping for tourists. Odaiba has a handful of things to see and do, but it's mostly about the shopping here, and the vast majority of people who visit are tourists from other parts of Japan and Asia to do just that. For all the trouble it takes to get out here, I really don't find Odaiba to be worth the effort. That being said, I imagine it has some appeal to families with kids as there are several amusements woven in with the shopping to keep the little ones occupied.

1 child for LegoLand!!!. Just so-so. It is at the bayside, you can see the Tokyo view - more romantic at night.Anyway if you like to go to the LegoLand, please make sure you are with at least 1 child under 12!! Because it was made for kids, you cannot get into it only adults.

Fun day out at Odaiba.. Our family of 6 had a great time here. We have a 14, 12, 7 and 6 year old. We went on a Saturday and the complex didn't open till 11am so don't get there too early. We took photo's infront of the Statue of Liberty for a bit of fun. The area is huge! There are lots of western shops for clothes shopping but no real big discounts and if your a traveller make sure you check if your buying something if the shop has a tax free flag infront of it or you might get and extra surprise at the check out. There was heaps to do with the kids. Madame Taussauds, Legoland, Joypolis and plenty of dining which was mainly Japanese style of food. If you go out side and cross the road you will find more shopping a little more like a normal shopping centre call Decks. There is also Palette Town where the big Ferris Wheel is but we didn't get that far. We ate in a huge food court over at decks. The one thing Japan does well is show you with their displays of food exactly what your meal will look like and menus are all written in English and Japanese. Overall we had a huge day and lots of fun as the main reason we went there was to visit the attractions.

Nice area. You can easily spend a day walking around Odaiba. I went there with a water bus, which was also a nice experience. There are many shopping centers and other attractions in Odaiba. You can even test drive cars in the Toyota MegaCenter and of course see the 1:1 Gundam model.
Cool Tokyo Bay. Not to be missed if you are in Tokyo. Make a day trip to Odaiba and enjoy the sights, shops and restaurants.

A lovely area in Tokyo.. Somehow distant from the city's center, this reclaimed area makes for a great stroll for a couple of hours.The area features a convention center, a theme park, a shopping mall, several parks and bridges, and it is so much different than the pact area of Ginza.Highly recommended, but prepare to walk and walk and walk, as the area is huge.

Odaiba beauty. Odaiba is a very nice area of Tokyo, where you can see a smaller-sized replica of the Statue of Liberty, Rainbow Bridge, and Gundam statue. Odaiba provides a beautiful, relaxing atmosphere during the night, and you will come across many couples sitting on the small beach or taking a scroll.

Must visit - Odaiba. Visiting Odaiba is a must! So many interesting places to see, we visited the:1. DiverCity Tokyo Plaza - took picture with Gundam Statue & have lunch at the food court2. Palette Town - went to Toyota Mega Web (took a free car testing ride which was interesting) and sat on the Ferris Wheel, the views were beautiful.2. Aqua City Odaiba - we took the pictures of Statue of Liberty and Rainbow Bridge both during sunset and at night. The pictures turned out to be really beautiful. We also bought quite a lot of things from Daiso and H&M store which was having sales. We had a wonderful day at Odaiba, We went there by Rinkai Line and took the Yurikamome line back in the night, although the rides cost much more than the other lines. The scenery was unforgettable and we really had a wonderful time. Odaiba is a place not to be missed!
Must visit place in Tokyo. Odaiba is magic place to spend a time. A lot of great attractions, restaurants and shopping!Was there probably 5 times and can keep going over and over again!

Shopping Madness!. Known as the 'man-made' island from several of my friends haha. One of the main reasons why we went here was because of its shopping madness - Aqua City and Venus Fort. In comparison, if you are big about your brands and love Las Vegas or haven't been to Las Vegas, go to Venus Fort. As for Aqua City, there are small fashion businesses there that you can look around for. Besides that, both are great. Memories will be cherished since it's a one-of-a-kind place!

Worth Visiting This Area. A great mix of attractions, shops and things to see at Odaiba. Wear your comfortable shoes, grab a map and go exploring. We enjoyed the Toyota showrooms and the range of free activities, as well as looking at the cars. Their is the giant ferris wheel nearby. The hidden car museum in the shopping mall was also excellent. The TV station provided some interest as well. Plenty of food options with cafes and restaurants. We wandered with a group of primary school aged students and easily filled in a half day without visiting any of the larger museums.

Giant Gundam and everything else. I've been here twice and plan to go again next time I'm in Tokyo. Actually the 1:1 ratio Gundam model is enough to make me come here but for others, you'd have everything you need here.

Back Again. I first visited Odaiba Island in October 2014. While I was on vacay in Tokyo in June, I decided to return to Odaiba Island as I suspected that I had not seen/done everything I should have on my last visit. This time, I learned something new. We caught the Rainbow Bus from Shinagawa to the island (it was a 20 minute ride). Fare is 210 yen one way or an all day pass is 500 yen. Suica and Pasmo not accepted for this bus. Apparently there is also a Tamachi and Hamamatsucho route. Its a economical option to get to/from Odaiba Island. The bus stops at multiple stops on the island. While here, revisited the "statue of liberty", Diver City, Oedo Onsen and Palette Town. Its such a beautiful place to visit - much calmer than the busy city.
Nice view of Rainbow bridge and Giant Gundam. If you want to take picture with real size of Gundam - you can find it here. And also look a like 'statue of liberty' with background of Rainbow Bridge.
Beautiful, must see. Go during the evening and you get a perfect view of the lit up rainbow bridge and the statue of liberty with the sunset in the background. Priceless..

Great area and plenty to do for the day. Allocate a day here. Lots to do, see, shop and eat. If you like gaming and anime genres you will enjoy Joypolis. Stop by Madame Tussauds. There's a Legoland right next to it but adults can only enter if they are accompanied by kids. Great tonkatsu place right next to Joypolis also.Don't forget to check out the life size Gundam unit too!

Must go to Fuji TV building!. Odaiba offers a relaxing atmosphere with its bayview instead of neon light in other wards in Tokyo. The Fuji TV building is a must go because you definitely will be amazed by its architecture and scale. Besides, its bayfront facing the Tokyo bay and rainbow bridge is another must go, especially for those who like to take lots of photos! There are also other attractions such as gundam mall..overall, this is really a mesmerizing place!

Great alternative of staying in the crowded downtown. We had chosen Odaiba as a place for our stay in Tokyo expecting more space, less crowds and flawless connection to the center. Everything was fine, the hotel with marvelous views, trains connecting with very convenient Shinbashi Station. Lots of shopping centers and additional attractions

Beautiful view of the city. Odaiba offers the best view of Tokyo and some of the best pictures at sunset. So many things to do, see and perfect setting. Clean, secure. the water does not call for a swim though, i don't know how people do it but if you like it it is a nice place.
Odaiba malls, museums. Odaiba is great place to visit whole day, several malls to visit, museums, bowling, movies. Madame Tussauds wax museum is great!

Nice place for refreshing in Tokyo. As a park that is wide enough, you have several places to sit back, flower gardens. Also the view of the Rainbow bridge, some of the nuances of the city, etc.While filling your spare time while in Tokyo, is an interesting place to visit. Given that there is beauty around, and while refreshing yourself.

Nice place to bring kids. The place is very close to each others. There are many museums, and place to shop. And there are places that kids can play (Joypolice, Lego Land, Big Gundam statue etc.). Foods are also great. I went to the sushi restaurant in one of the mall, Driver City, and the food are great. Nice place to bring kids.

an adult wonderland. I had such an amazing time in Odaiba I missed my flight back home. Odaiba is an amazing place. it is not on a natural island, it doesn't have a history or traditions, it is just.. pure future. you can ride a giant wheel, you can take pictures of a giant mecha suit, you can visit the science museum, you can bathe in hot baths (If you don't have any tattoos)I would suggest enjoying the train ride over, visiting the Miraikan museum of science, checking out the Gundam statue and taking a stroll along the beach!and don't miss your flight! or do, I had a blast either way.

My Favorite place on the world/ Mi lugar favorito en el mundo. There was something that is magical in that place, I don't know why but Every single time I go over there I get in love of it more and more.You have this lovely vew, with an excellent weather, you can enjoy both parts of the japanese cities like the futurist part with building that blow your mind or a traditional part, like the onsen, but is the place that you have to see before you die.Había algo que es mágico en ese lugar, no sé por qué, pero cada vez que voy allí me meto en el amor de el más y más.Usted tiene esta hermosa vista espectacular , con un excelente clima , se puede disfrutar de las dos partes de las ciudades de Japón como la parte futurista con el edificio que volar tu mente o una parte tradicional , como el onsen , pero es el lugar que tienes que ver antes de morir.
Great for shopping. Good place for shopping and eating. With many attractions such as Legoland. We went to the Disney Store in Aqua City to buy our Tickets to Disney Sea & Disneyland.
Nice to use the train just to get an overview of this area. A long walk from the stations along the Yurikamome line. But the train ride was great. Get a seat at the front of the train if possible.

Fantastic day out. We spent our first day here after an overnight flight with two young children. It was the perfect choice. Easy to get to and plenty of attractions within walking distance, which helped keep the jet lag at bay. Lots of food choices at reasonable prices as well. Would definitely recommend.

Great place to spend a day. Getting to Odaiba from Tokyo centre is fun: just take a driverless monorail train that will get you across the bridge and enjoy the view.On Odaiba you can find shopping malls and a huge museum. Temporal festivals take place here (we were lucky to be here during the Beer Festival) and of course an amazing view of the city at night.The Statue of Liberty (a copy of the one in NY) is also a must see.The Rainbow Bridge supposedly is changing colors at night but we didn't see that even though we stayed until it was late.
Another great place in Japan. I went to Odaiba at night, and we can see the city lights from seaside. Breathtaking!!! There's also a Liberty statue to see..

Tokyo upon sea. This is a modern area but with a nice promenade and smallish beach (not sure I would venture into the water in Tokyo bay though). There are plenty of restaurants and a large shopping mall. The Starbucks is a nice place to take breakfast and watch over the Rainbow bridge.

Just like any urban center. Shopping malls after shopping malls. Venus Fort unique from the rest is because it is designed like the Ceasar's Palace or the Venetian, European street settings with piazza complete with humongous fountain. It stages very realistic sunrise and sunsets. Quirky but fun for photographing moments. My highlight in Odaiba , was the chance to view the Rainbow bridge beautifully lited at night nestled amidst a million twinkling city lights as its background at the HIBIKI restaurant , 6th loose of Aquacity

Awesome tourist island. I loved the variety of shops and eateries on the island. Everything from high end shopping to posing with a huge robot (Gundam Statue at Diver City). Great place for families, couples and solo people alike. There's something for everyone.Only con would be that it's an obvious tourist area and those seeking for the "feel" of Tokyo may not like how it is not authentic Tokyo. Still though, Tokyo bay is a gorgeous site so while you may miss the authenticity of being in crowded Tokyo, you will enjoy the ample space and variety of activities that were designed for the foreign traveler.
Beautiful one day trip.. I spend there with two friends lovely one day trip. We just walked around, tried the beer on the OktoberFest - very good.

Entertainment in Tokyo Bay. Odaiba is an entertainment district in Tokyo Bay. The best access to Odaiba is by Yurikamome - it is an automated, elevated train connecting Shimbashi Station with Odaiba. The Yurikamome line crosses the Rainbow Bridge and offers spectacular views of the harbor.

Fun place to go.. Easy to get to by train. Train travel is very efficient in Japan. Definitely a must for something different.
Fun place to go.

Worth a visit. While I wouldn't put Odaiba as a "must do" if you're in Tokyo only for a couple days, I would certainly add it to the agenda if there is enough time during your trip. Plenty of shopping, Legoland adventure area for the kids, a madame tussauds, ferris Wheel, joypolis is pretty neat for kids and adults alike. Again. A nice area..Plenty to do and see..But not "traditional touristy Japan" versus modern.

A must-stop TOKYO!. Tons thing to do here, came here on evening and the place is filled with decorative lights..Visit the Palette Town Shopping centre. a unique interior decor with classic design and outdoor sky lookalike ceiling.wait around the Divercity at 9pm to watch the GUNDAM statue show.. its really awesome in night!
A must visit in Tokyo!. This is where Gundam huge robot is situated. But the main attraction in the area is the replica of New York's Statue of Liberty. Perfect place for pictorial.

Interesting place. A nice walk on the Odaiba sea front to "Gundam" Robot with lots of interesting places and sceneary. There are many interesting buildings like Fuji TV building and Aqua city mall.We crossed over to the island using Rainbow Bridge which presented a very grand view .

Could spend the whole day here if you like shopping. There are many shops and restaurants in this area. There are also some sights for photo taking, such as the Statue of Liberty, the Rainbow bridge, and Gundum. The area is a bit away from the center of Tokyo, however, it is easy to reach. There is a day-pass train ticket with unlimited rides for visiting Odaiba, but we found that most of the places are within walking distance, so I would suggest just buying regular single-trip ticket to go there instead of buying the day pass.
It's a must to see at night. I got a special birthday ticket! It was discounted and got me sweet gift in one of the cafes. Fantastic views. Live entertainment. Super!

^w^ Great place! . There is a life size gundam next to a shopping centre called diver city. The shopping centre is quite big and there are many shops that sell souvenirs. The gundam cafe is small so you might consider going to the the gundam cafe at Akihabara. There is a gundam museum at the 7th floor of the shopping centre and part of it is free.There are many shopping centers around and it feels good to walk around & take pictures near the sea! The Tokyo teleport station is quite convenient.

This area is so different to the rest of Tokyo. Odaiba covers a vast area however there is an elevated train. We walked around the different buildings so it is do-able with reasonable fitness. All fairly new, so don't look for history here. Plenty of shopping opportunities and restaurants. Particularly liked the Toyota Megaweb & Venue Port. Gundam robot is a photo opportunity. Statue of Liberty seems out of place until your inside One of the buildings and realise there's an American themed area. I sense this area will be well utilised during the 2020 Olympics.

Modern and large open spaces for walking or jogging. Modern and large open spaces for walking or jogging in Odaiba. Also several places of intererst. Maritime Museum, Aqua City for shopping and modern Fuji TV. Panasonic showroom. Free Shuttle bus in Odaiba. Gundam Project. Ferris Wheel. Toyota showroom, try your car. Car Museum

Great area!. Odaiba was a great little area to visit. Lots of shops, restaurants, amusements, arcades, the equivalent of a London eye, a giant robot and the museum of innovation and technology which is home of Asimo the robot. What's not to like?

Family friendly place. A lovely place where you get to shop, eat, watch performance, take pictures of the rainbow bridge, cars exhibition, etc. The restaurant I went was very good and value for money and I bought myself some sports wear at discounted price. Not a bad place to visit if you have extra half a day to spend.

Nice view. I went there at night. It was a very peaceful place. I sit on the beach, smell thefresh smell and I enjoyed a beautiful night view of the rainbow bridge. I recommend you guys don't miss visiting this place especially at night! You will love it!

Meh. So ... It's a fake island with a fake beach and a shopping mall and a big Ferris wheel ... nothing to write home about. There is an excellent Bill's restaurant ... but if you are holidaying in Tokyo, why on earth would you want to eat in the restaurant of a Sydney celebrity chef?! Not my scene.

Great on a cycle tour. Good for children
Man made island, very ordinary man made beach
a lot of construction going on, will be great in a few years time heading towards the 2020 olympics

Great Fun. I didn't do too much research on Odaiba during my visit to Japan because of Time constraint, I only know there are rainbow bridge, gundam, and liberty statue. I wish I did some research, then I would spare 1 whole day to visit Odaiba. The gundam statue was awesome, but they also have Maddame Tussaud and Trick Art Museum which I only know about them as I arrived at Odaiba (around 7pm so no time haha). You definitely need to spare 1 day just to visit Odaiba since they have so many attractions, the view accross the sea to Tokyo also nice during night time

Nice area, great night-time views. I had to go there because I was visiting Miraikan, but it was worth walking around. Near the giant ferris wheel you can the latest Toyota cars. Walk to the East and you will see the big robot. If you're visiting in the evening, you will be rewarded with amazing views of Rainbow Bridge, Tokyo Tower and Statue of Liberty.

GUNDAM..!!!!!!. I read somewhere that taking the Rinkai Line to Odaiba was more fun and indeed it was well worth the trip. There were shopping malls to visit, SEGA Joypolis, really nice scenery. Only regret was not having time to visit the famous Oedo Onsen. If your're a fan of Gundam then it's a must visit.

Great area. I would say it is good for families although we enjoyed our stay. There are lots of shopping malls where you can eat at a reasonable cost. Near one of the Malls is a big wheel and somebody said a car Museum. There is also the only Beach in Tokyo but no swimming? There's a pleasant little train that takes you to the main station to access Tokyo. There are also the main offices of big companies like Sony and Fuji. You can take the hop on off bus tour from here.

Odaiba day trip. Odaiba is a great place for fans of Japanese tv and shopping. I enjoy Japanese drama and the Fuji TV building is a landmark featured in many movies and tv shows. The have studio recordings that you can observe. To go up into the ball section of the building it's about a $5 ride. That's a rough estimate depending on the exchange rate. You will have to pay in Yen of course. When I went the feature at the top is Dragon Ball Z since they will have a new story coming out the hype is all about Dragon Ball Z right now. If you have just one place you want to focus on you can make a day trip of it. But if you want to see all the different shopping centers, rides and event's you will need a couple of days.

Great new built area. Big man made island of Odaiba lies in the Tokyo bay. It hosts a dozen of attractions starting with Tokyo Disneyland, Madame Tussauds, Toyota car museum, Lego, Fuji TV headquarters, shopping outlets,,, So, if you wish to visit them all, you'll need at least two days.We crossed the famous Rainbow bridge just to admire the area, and have some perfect pics of the entire Tokyo bay with Tokyo panorama. I advise to come there at dusk, so you can catch daylight, as well the better nighttime scenery.A lot of restaurants and food courts around to spend a wonderful evening.

Modern on the bay. A brand new train line is open to visit the man-made island of Odaiba in Tokyo Bay. The driver-less train is brand new and the fees are graduated depending on stops. The malls and restaurants out there are new and have a lot of American options. I wish we could have spent more time out here rather than just an evening. Great view of the Rainbow Bridge as well as the city skyline.

Gundam!!!!. We only spent half a day here which was not enough. Easily need a day if you're into things like Gundam, lego etc. one thing though...you can't go inside the lego museum unless you have a kid with you..WHAT?!! overall I had a blast

Across the Rainbow Bridge from Tokyo. Odaiba is a large artificial island built a while back for defensive purposes and highly developed since the ‘90s and everything in this quiet neighborhood is fairly new/modern. There are 4 large shopping centers with lots of restaurants to satisfy the gourmet. Nice views of the harbor. Many points of access to train/subways.
Cars. The History Museum of Cards made the whole trip to Odaiba worthwhile. I'm not a car person but the ones on display kept me entertained. They were not the routinely displayed models.

So not Japan. It's a nice (new) modern place that is a copy paste from the U.S., there you will find the statue of liberty and the bridge, you cannot feel any Japanese culture over there. I advice for first comers to go and take a look, you can walk, take pictures, go shopping in the mall. But to me it's not one of my tops places in Japan.

Shopping, restaurant, seaside, bridges - lots to do. We visited Odaiba for 4 hours, but could have stayed for much longer.Odaiba is like a seaside "fun town". It reminded me a little bit of St Kilda in Melbourne. When we arrived off of the River Cruise boat there were a lot of people down on the beach splashing in the water and generally basking in the sun. It was a lovely sunny day.There are a few different shopping centres here, we spent most of our time in Decks. I think the other one is more of an entertainment complex. We didn't get to the Museums or other places - I heard that there is also an Onsen onsite, but we didn't get to see it as we were a little tired from walking all day.Restaurants on the top floor of Decks have an amazing view of Tokyo city, there are many different styles of food to choose from. We sat on the balcony and stayed to watch the sunset - it was really beautiful. You have a great view of the Rainbow bridge as well.Catch the automatic train back to Tokyo, it was quite full when we left as it was peak travel time, but it doesn't take long (only about 15 mins).

lovely. Whenever I visit Tokyo, I go there and sit on the beach. While looking around the beach I feel free:)There are many place to do shopping! I usually go to Venus Port to buy some presents for my family and friends. But in summer, because there are not enough shadow, you may feel really hot....! You have to prepare sunglasses if you have plan to visit~! Buy beer, go to beach(better in the evening), drink!

The UAE part of Tokyo. This is the neighbourhood of business,modern architecture,entertainment,shopping etc .Our decision to stay there at Nikko hotel it was really very good and quite value for money as we stayed on Sunday and Monday nights...

A lovely area, very like Docklands in London. The big wheel was the second largest in Japan, it was a very windy day, and frankly I was scared at the top, even though I generally love heights!The car museum is free and really superb, anywhere else in the world this would be charged for!A Delight was the area for shopping which was designed like the casinos in Las Vegas.Shopping was good and there were a good choice of food outlets.Do take the train to get there, the journey is superb, with lovely views of Tokyo and the rainbow bridge,

lots to do. this is a nice area with lots of shopping and attractions - but a bit removed from tokyo city proper - have to go across rainbow bridge, but easily done by train.it has the feel of a shopping/tourist area anywhere in teh developed world - not a very "East Asian" feel. still had cool shops and attractions and was clean and safe

Magical at night. Really good looking skyline at night and fantastic elevated train service from Shiadome. Go over before sunset, watch the sun go down, have dinner at one of the many restaurants and then get the train back.

heaps to do!. a great little area of Tokyo you could spend all day here! big shopping centres like Decks, Aquacity, Divercity and Palettetown/Venus Fort. each one has heaps of shops and other attractions, don't forget to see the big Gundam robot, pretty cool! We visited on a rainy day and it was perfect to explore for the day and everything is close to eachother.

Can be quiet at times.... Went here Friday night and was really quiet. Good for shopping I imagine and had a great meal at a restaurant within DECKS Tokyo Beach overlooking the bay, but that's about it. I'd recommend for the latter (which was great) but little else.

Take a break from Tokyo and enjoy the views. Odaiba is always a nice trip and it's a great way to spend the day. Hop on the Yurikamome (from Shiodome for ex.) and enjoy the view as you cross over the water then stop wherever you like to pick from a variety of shopping areas. Definitely stop by Divers City (there are raised walkways) to see the "life size" Gundam and do some more shopping.Once you're done, head to the man-made beach then eat at a restaurant with nighttime views of the bay, bridge, and lights!Definitely a good way to spend the day with something for almost everyone.

play, shop, walk. Odaiba is a great place for shopping and entertainment. There is also the live size Gundam robot, and the Earthquake museum which is worth experiencing.It's a good place to spend a leasurely day in Tokyo

Another wonderful getaway within Tokyo. Ride the skyway out over the Tokyo harbor and enter another world. You can stroll along the beach and embankment or you can bury yourself inside in a fantastic arcade. Lots of good shopping too.

Great place for a day trip. Start the day with a sushi breakfast at tsujiki or monjayaki at monjastreet and move on to odaiba. be sure to buy a day pass for the water front train and ride it at least one way along the rainbow bridge. Odaiba got it several different sights and places such as aqua city, diver city, onsen, tokyo big site and several nice parks along the shore line. visiting odaiba on a sunny day is highly recommended. be sure to stay until dawn and watch rainbow bridge in its full colors.
Real size Gundam outside the DiverCity. There is a real size Gundam outside the DiverCity Tokyo Plaza. I'm really impressed. And In the Decks Odaiba, there is a ghost house. It's very scary.

Great during the day, very quiet at night. Odaiba offers a little of everything for everyone. It is a great place for shopping as it has a few shopping malls. It has a great selection of restaurants, museums, fantastic views of Tokyo, onsen, etc all contained within a small island. Take the Yurikanome train to Odaiba as the view is great from the train ride. Once on Odaiba, if you are short on time, I suggest going to Diver City to see the giant Gundam and do a little shopping. In my opinion Diver City is the best mall on Odaiba as it has a greater selection than Venus Fort or AquaCity. However for food, Auqacity and Decks next door has a greater selection of restaurants. Some of them also offers a great view of Tokyo.
Great Views. The train ride alone to Odaiba offers spectacular views. Once there, you can look back across the bay at the Tokyo skyline and Rainbow Bridge. The onset on Odaiba is a fun experience.

Great for a couple of days. Diver City is a fantastic Shopping Center and there are some other great attractions. However it becomes a bit boring after 3 days so I would move to another location if you are on Holidays

Mixed bag. Spent our last day in Tokyo at Odaiba. Found it was a bit of a mixed bag, I think because were weren't travelling with kids. A few of the places we visited (the science and innovation museum and sony explora) were very obviously geared towards children, so were either very busy or not very interesting for us. The shopping was also a bit mixed, not as good a variety as some other areas. MegaWeb and the giant Gundam were pretty cool, though we were cursing not realising we needed EU driving licence things to drive a car at MegaWeb. There were a few things we didn't really see, due to time but all in all was quite a good experience though maybe not the highlight of our trip.
view from Daiba. view from Daiba island is excellent, nearest hotel is Grand Pacific and Hotel Nikko. City panoramic view and Rainbow bridge make a perfect combination here.

Cool to see, unique take on "American" stuff. We enjoyed walking the area and taking in all the different sites. From the huge robot to the chocolate covered fresh fried potato chips- there is a ton to try in this huge pedestrian zone. There is a copy of the Statue of Liberty, shops galore and more food than anyone could possible want. We are a large family, so we didn't have the money to spend on the ferris wheel. It was loads of fun without that added expense. We also hit the science museum that's a 3 minute walk from there because it is free on Saturday. Enjoy!

Odaiba's main attraction at Diver City. Gundam! Run, it's a Gundam!As a fan of the series, it's impressive gauge one of these against human sizes. We didn't spend a lot of time here (other than to ogle to Shonen Jump building across the street) as I had a cunning plan to surprise the girls with Anime Expo.Gundam shopping and Gundam cafe all available. But we were on a clock.Note: a criticism. the flaggings on the unit say SCV-70 Whitebase, but I believe that's the designation for Gundam support vehicle/carrier. This looks more like the original RX-78-2.

Interesting way to spend half a day. Easy to get to by train, limited English speaking people in the huge shopping centre, the ferris wheel is a waste of time and money. The arcades are OK, the food was nice, there were a lot of interesting things to look at

An entertainment area all by itself. Odaiba offers a mix of entertainment pleasures from reasonable shopping in Venus Fort to the Toyota Museum at Mega Web on one side of the area to the seaside resort on the other. It is worth investing half a day to see this area. Combined with a ride on the Water Bus and/or a ride on the Yurikomome driver-less train it is a nice outing. There is even an onsen public bath for those who wish to experience that particular Japanese institution.Food is very accessible and reasonable at the various malls there, so it should be easy to plan a day's outing to the area. There is a fair bit of walking needed to see all the various offerings, so dress appropriately for the day.

One of the best place. Take a water boat ( cruise) from asakusa to odaiba...worth every penny. odaiba is man made island with lot of shopping malls and small sea side shore to enjoy. Rainbow bridge view in the evening is must see.

My Favourite Place in Tokyo. Maybe, it's the geek in me but Odaiba remains my favourite place in Tokyo. The Toyota Mega Web does not interest me that much after one visit, though, but all other places are worthy of repetitive explorations..

Reclaimed City in Tokyo Bay. We rode the metro coming here and walked all over the place, and enjoyed the train and then the elevated walk ways. First we visited the Toyota Car City (free and must see), then walk to the Aquacity Mall for some ramen and gyosa. We then proceeded to the Decks Tokyo Beach and found the Statue of Liberty and the beautiful rainbow bridge. We had a delightful surprise since the Sakura (Cherry Bloosom) along the roads are already in blooms. One day stroll here is not enough. We will return and stay in one of the hotels to further enjoy and explore the place.
gundam robot is here at odaiba. lots of malls in the areagreat place to walk aroundthere is even a statue of liberty heretry to see gundam robot at nightwill visit again
Mega Malls, Toyota Cars City & Car Museum. Lots of Restaurants and Tax Free Retail Shops, Near Train Station and Great Night Views over Tokyo Bay
The future. It's a artificial Island, with the buildings of 2050! It has the Fuji Tv headquartes, museums, a mini-statue of liberty, and some futuristics buildings!

Quiet and clean, plenty of shopping. We took the train to this place and was happy to find the quaint boutiques which sell a variety of products- good quality catering to all sorts of budgets. There is also game shop where my kids stayed most of the time while I went shopping where else, we love it. The views are amazing- you see the water amidst the modern jungle t hat is Tokyo. But it entails a lot of walking so be prepared!

Great mall, giant Gundam, beautiful parks, Statue of Liberty replica. This man made island is a great destination if you want to hit the gigantic shopping center, wander in the parks or check out the 30 foot tall Gundam statue. Within the park is an authentic replica of The Statue of Liberty, which was originally on loan from Paris but after the exhibition returned home, the Japanese petitioned the French government to build a replica. It's a beautiful spot with great views of the city and the bay.

So much shopping! And activites :). Came in on the underground train because it was cheaper - although I should come back one day on the driverless above ground trains because it was obvious that the views would have been breathtaking. It was a cloudy and a bit foggy on the day I went but I think it made Odaiba feel even more surreal. Bluish glass and metal everywhere for a super futuristic feel. Shopped til we dropped at the Hello Kitty store at Divers City Mall - walked away with the purchases in a giant paper shopping bag and the large adorable kitty on the side had people coming up to us all day asking where the shop was.Divers City food court's affordable meals smelled absolutely delicious from the entrance to the mall - and the food didn't disappoint either. Walked by the large Gundam statue by the food court doorway and then headed up to view and photograph the rainbow bridge and mini statue of liberty. Saw a elvis tribute group who set up - they were *very* quickly barred from performing by mall security, aw.Only saw a few stores in Aqua City Mall next to the mini statue of liberty and then it was already dark. Went outside and watched the light&music show start on the Fuji-tv building (can't miss it, it's the futuristic building with a large bronzish globe set into the top middle. Spent quite a while trying to figure out if the few offices still lit on that Sunday evening were distracted from their work by the lights - we concluded no based on the colors of ceiling tiles we saw. Took night pictures of the rainbow bridge and mini-liberty. Even saw a really gorgeous bride get pictures taken with the bridge and twinkling city lights behind - her pictures will be spectacular.Onwards to the Ferris wheel! Walked though Venus Fort Mall to get there. Went into the mall through the history garage with many shiny classic cars. Inside Venus Fort, it was done up like the Venetian of Las Vegas, blue ceilings with clouds and classic tan stone facades inside. Spent time walking through Megaweb, a car retailer with an *enormous* indoor showroom. So strange to see so many people looking at the cars because I'm used to US auto lots, where it's usually only you and the employees walking around.Decided to take the entirely 'clear' Ferris wheel capsule - slightly longer wait but worth it for the experience.Went back to Divers City for dinner. Really wanted to try the halal friendly buffet inside Aqua city but was still stuffed from lunch. Watched the Gundam show by the large Gundam statue - short cartoon show where the Gundam's head moved and lights flashed in sync with the projected scene. Note there is no where to sit in the Gundam cafe - take your food into the Diver's City food court which is right next door. Show times are projected onto the large tv screen except during the show itself when the screen is turned off and everything is projected to the left, onto the wall of the mall.All shops closed at 9pm which was so sad - I still wanted to do more shopping!--A note which apply all over Tokyo - we needed to find a nursing room in the middle of the day but the information desk workers don't always speak fluent English. Not impossible situation to work through, just FYI.
amazing views!. Loved the views over Tokyo Bay from here! To arrive here you can take the monorail - loved it! The journey to this place was fantastic alone!

So much to do; lots of fun. Our first full day in Tokyo was spent almost exclusively in Odaiba - a mix of jetlag and being overly keen meant we arrived before anything had opened, but once it all got started Odaiba provided an amazing start to our holiday.The National Museum of Emerging Science was our first stop - incredible technology you were allowed to try hands-on, such as virtual reality gaming and mecha robots (you can spend hours here). We then went to Diver City and saw the massive Gundam, before stopping at the Venus Fort for a drink. Next was the huge ferris wheel, which gave an awesome view of Tokyo, and Leisureland where you could easily lose several hours (and several thousand yen) with the unbelievable variety of arcade entertainment. It had table tennis against a machine (I think I lost), basketball, football and baseball (!) as well as the usual video games, grabbers and medal machines. The only downside here for tourists is that the instructions can be hard to understand on certain games.We made our way back through the Decks and had a nice Mexican late lunch at the Zest Cantina. Then it was back across Rainbow Bridge and into the heart of Tokyo again as night fell on a great day out. The best part about Odaiba is that we didn't even do half of it.
Fantastic view and malls. Great place to visit for family outing. Great malls connected to each other, great foods, great coffee shops.

Mindblowing beauty. In one words if I have to explain - MINDBLOWING. You should take a tour to & fro to get the feel in the driverless train. (Train can be taken from Shimbashi station) You should occupy the front seat in the train to get a full view. Main attraction - DAIBA - Aqua city and opposite to aqua city where you can go upto 25 floor and get a full view of Tokyo. Next to Daiba station - Huge robot - must visit. Also in one station - Simulated car drive by Toyota. Inside Aqua city - Duty free shopping and theatre. The beauty of the place is the seaside. You may go inside the water approx half a km in the bridge. "Must go place". Not to miss Maritime museum.

Worth the trip on the train.. First things first, its basically shopping malls and an entertainment complex.Okay, you have a massive robot, which is kind of cool, the Sega Joypolis which is great for kids and the kids at heart, a cinema, and a science museum, which is cool, but not really worth the entrance fee.If you are in Tokyo for a while, go here but if you've only got a few days, give it a miss and try some other sites.

Gundam!. Shops are brilliant and a large food court with lots of delicious food. Outside is a full scale gundam model that moves which was brilliant fun and a short stroll from the museum to see asimo and there is so much to do here, great for families! Also where you get the ferry back, there's a Statue of Liberty and a beach too. A great day out!

diver city mall is a must. since i'm a Gundam's fan boy. you can find a huge Gundam here! :Dotherwise, you can walking around Toyota museum, seeing around at Rainbow bridge, or just go shopping on a many malls there.
Interesting place. You can found giant gundam here! Near from the giant gundam you can found a Tokyo landscape but taste like a New York with liberty statue and the bridge.

Great View, Giant Gundam, Lots to See, Do and Photograph!. As a amateur photorapher I really enjoyed taking photos towards the bridge and the Tokyo Skyline! There are a few spots which you should see while touring Odaiba including Aquacity, the Fuji TV Building, DiverCity Tokyo Plaza + Live Size Gundam. You can also enjoy a great view from the closely located Ferris Wheel.

Good place to visit. Odaiba is a good place to visit. You can go there by train, boat or car. There are many shops and restaurants, so you can go there with your friends or family and have a good time in the holiday. I like the night scene of Odaiba. The Rainbow bridge in night is so beautiful. There is a Statue of Liberty in Odaiba, but it is smaller than the one in New York. I think you will like this place after you visit it.

Lots to see and do.. We stopped here for a short time on an organised tour. I wish we had the time to go back and spend more time there as I don't believe we got to see everything. Statue of Liberty is here - nice place to stop.

Must-see!. Another perspective of modern Japan! This is a break from the classic Metropolitan Tokyo. Went here to cap off our afternoon and evening in one of our vacation days in Tokyo and it was perfect! Dine and eat in an alfresco restaurant overlooking the sea and city lights.

Great place to spend time. Odaiba is a great place to spend time during the free time. There are beach, outlet stores, hot spring and Madame Tussaud's. I went there last Friday. There are many stores having a sale. I bought good shoes at a low price. Then there are Oedo Hot Spring, which are around ten minutes form Odaiba station. The hot spring is good and the charge is not expensive. In Madame Tussaud's Tokyo, you can see Japanese popular talent and celebrities. Finally, Odaiba's night view is very beautiful.
Complete fun package. With madame tussauds. Lego land and other activities this man made island is surely going to make uou go crazy.

Shop + Gundam Seekers. Odaiba is really good spot to shop, take photos and dine. You can see the big statue of Gundam at Diver City. Or even visit the Gundam Musuem/Cafe inside the mall. Truly great experience
Must visit!!!. Can't get enough of this place, so modern, charming and rich. You can easily spend a full day there eating, shopping and roaming around.

Great location. First time to Tokyo, wasn't sure where to put the family, chose the Grand Pacific Le Daiba which is within walking distance of the light rail and the Daiba shopping district. Only quick trip into Tokyo central from here - and its a magic spot. Great CBD views and views of Rainbow Bridge.. water front park is particularly nice.

Beautiful Place. This is a nice place to visit. It is very quiet. There are a lot of things you can do here. There's the Miraikan, Gundam Front, Mega Web, Legoland Discovery Center, etc. One day will not be enough to go around. Also, the train ride going here is also enjoyable although long if you're coming from Shimbashi station. It's a peaceful man-made island, away from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo. It's definitely a must-visit destination in Tokyo.

the best from tokyo. nice artificial island, you can spend a lot of time there without getting bored .... you have great places to visit, to shop, to eat , to drink and to relax at a japanese bath ...

Entertaining. So much to see and do here. We went on the 30th anniversary of Gundam, when the giant robot had been built which was like nothing we had ever seen before! In one day we saw the Fuji TV Building, (mini) Statue of Liberty, National Museum of Emerging science and Innovation, with Asimo the robot, Sega Joyopolis in Decks shopping mall and Rainbow Bridge. Definitely worth a visit

Nice Cool Trip. I was lucky to visit the place with a beautiful backdrop. The sky was very BLUE, so the photos were very beautiful. Nice shopping malls around the park , all within walking distance.Deck Mall houses the Jap version of Tokyo Trick eye Museum , the ticket price is reasonable.There is a retro toy level / toy street in this mall too. The beach park is very windy and you feel really relax to enjoy the breeze and cool winter air. I took about 40 min to travel from Shinjuku.Odaiba is very different compare to the busy shinjuku area. It is an oasis in the city.
Tourist Trap. Fancy malls with lots of attractions like Gundam Front Tokyo and the Toyota Mega Web. There's even a Statue of Liberty replica. Easy access with lots of dining options.

The mall has it all. Odaiba is overwhelming. You can see the Statue of Liberty and a giant Gundam not far from one another. You can ride a boat up the river if you choose, and if you're lucky like I was, you can see a Japanese model photo shoot on the stairs next to the river.A Sega Joypolis location is here in Odaiba and there's a little arcade across from it. Down the hall is an entire store devoted to Michael Jackson. I've never seen such a thing.The TV station is here, but I didn't visit it. Odaiba is just a cool place and you should check it out. Spend more than two hours there.

Good for a whole day's entertainment. This is our second trip to Odaiba. We visited last year on a wet weekday and that experience paled in comparison to our recent second visit. It was a beautiful clear winter's day and it was a Sunday which made the whole experience a more lively and eventful. There were Christmas stalls and buskers, a car race by Toyota, vans selling food outside one of the malls... A wonderful day out.

Gundam!!!. There are quite a number iconic sites to see at this place namely the Gundam robot, Statue of Liberty, the Ferris wheel, flame of freedom, seven rainbow bridge, motor car museum and lotsa shopping. Did I mention the Gundam robot? Personally, that would be the major highlight of this area that is so unique that I doubt you can find it anywhere else. Definitely a good place for family outing.

Fun area to hang out for the whole day.. Odaiba is a beautiful area about half an hour away outside of central Tokyo. There is A LOT to do here. You have so many options for entertainment, including Joypolis, an indoor amusement park and museums such as madame tussauds. The options for good food is plenty. Check out takoyaki museum, which is really a food court with takoyaki restaurants from all over Japan. Shopping is great around here too, Venus fort is my personal favorite. It's a beautiful shopping mall with an outlet section on the top floor. After all the fun you can then go to a Japanese onsen (hot spring bath) place for relaxation. You just never run out of things to do in Odaiba! If you have more than just a few days in Tokyo than I definitely recommend spending a whole day here.
